title: DRAFTING AND ENGINEERING MANAGER
description: A leader in the Architecture Precast Industry, is looking to add a Drafting and Engineering Manager to their Coordination/Detailing/Engineering Team in Fremont. In this role you'll be helping to lead a growing team of Project Managers and Project Engineers coordinating, designing, and detailing panelized skin systems. You'll also be responsible for implementing and maintaining a Company Standards library. This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated self-starter to get their foot in the door of a great company with tons of room for growth and learning.Required skills and experience:You are proficient in the use of AutoCAD 2012 and 3D modeling.Revit experience a plusAbility to troubleshoot AutoCAD issuesAbility to read & interpret construction plans and specsStrong multi tasking and organizational skillsExcellent leadership skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsBS degree Civil Engineering preferred (PE a plus)Most important: You are responsible, eager to learn, and not afraid to ask questions. You have a sense of urgency and drive to succeed.10+ years Precast Concrete experienceWhat We Provide You...Client values its employees' contributions and believes strongly in promoting from within. We provide a competitive compensation and benefits package, including a bonus program, medical, dental and vision coverage, 401(K), paid time off and holidays and more. The salary range for this position is open depending on qualifications. In addition, we offer the opportunity to work with a phenomenal and elite group of individuals.CONTACT: Gene VineyardGene.Vineyard@ConcreteCareers.com877-5 WIN WIN (877-594-6946)770-639-5176 CellPosition Summary:The individual in this position is responsible for all aspects of precast concrete manufacturing with the exception of the QA, Batch Plant and Delivery teams. This includes the development of operating plans and department goals as well as the “hands on” coaching, mentoring and performance management of associates in Production, the Yard, Maintenance, Garage, Carpenter Shop and Rebar Facility. The Manager - Production has ultimate responsibility for safety, quality and productivity within these teams, as well as all work performed by these teams at job sites. This individual is also involved in proactively reviewing incoming and managing ongoing projects, working with Team Leaders, Supervisors and Managers to complete all work in the safest and most efficient manner possible. All duties and responsibilities must be carried out with a complete adherence and commitment to the Company’s Philosophy Statement and Vision Statement.Duties and Responsibilities:Coach, mentor and manage performance of individual team members, including a small team of front line supervisors, to ensure the highest levels of safety, quality and productivity in these departments. Lead and develop by setting clear expectations and holding individuals accountable for performance. Recognize success and immediately address performance issues.Be proactive in improving the safety of the work environment for all associates, leading by example, developing/communicating safe operating procedures and enforcing the use of safe work methods (i.e. proper personal protective equipment, machine guards on tools, etc). Stay abreast of all applicable Federal and State regulations.Identify training needs for all associates, from new or less experienced associates to Team Leaders and Supervisors. Conduct and/or facilitate formal and informal training. Ensure that ongoing training is provided regarding hazards in the workplace and all safety and health procedures.Ensure that all associates understand the procedure for reporting safety and health incidents, including near misses, and that all incidents are reported, documented and investigated. Identify trends that may indicate unsafe work procedures or other types of hazards in the work environment.Establish department goals that align with and ensure achievement of company goals.Seek continuous improvement in the manufacturing process. Develop and implement procedures to improve safety, quality and productivity. Ensure consistent adherence to all procedures and quality standards in all production buildings.Prepare the annual operating plan for all departments except QA, Batch Plant and Delivery, recommending and justifying capital expenditures both short term and long term. Review monthly financial statements for all departments and work to manage within or below the operating plan.Review production cost reports in a timely manner, comparing estimated to actual expenditures on a project specific basis. Make recommendations to the estimating department or changes to the production process as necessary.Actively participate, along with other members of the Fort Miller team, in pre-bid and ongoing meetings with owners, contractors and consultants to discuss upcoming projects. Provide input during these meetings on design feasibility, making suggestions and recommendations based on the project design, time line, and/or project constraints.Thoroughly review projects before they hit the shop floor, proactively identifying any production issues that may arise, additional materials that may be required, etc. This involves working closely with other department managers, purchasing and members of the production, maintenance, carpenter and/or rebar teams.Work closely with the Engineering Department on existing projects to resolve design and production issues, ensuring compliance with project specifications in the event that changes are made.Ensure that the facility is clean and well organized following the principles of 5S.Carry out all supervisory responsibilities in accordance with our Philosophy Statement, company policies and applicable laws. Provide guidance and effective counseling to associates in the work environment, consulting with the President and the VP - HR on more complex issues.Any other duties as may be required to enhance the goals and objectives of The Fort Miller Co., Inc.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:BS in Civil Engineering or Civil Engineering Technology. MBA preferred.Professional Engineer license preferred.Demonstrated management and leadership skills, including 3-5 years in a management position.Precast concrete knowledge, including product forming, pouring, curing, handling, storage and shipping. Pre-stress manufacturing experience preferred.Ability to read and interpret complex contract plans and shop drawings.Strong communication skills, including oral presentation and writing skills.Interface seamlessly with peer managers to identify opportunities for improvement, resolve issues, etc.Ability to be open, honest and consistent with others and the ability to communicate effectively at all levels. The ability to practice active listening.Excellent decision making skills, including the ability to make decisions on complex issues with limited information.Ability to multi-task and perform in an environment with constant interruptions.Excellent mathematical skills and the ability to perform engineering calculations.Ability to work closely with individuals within and outside the Company.Physical Requirements:Ability to withstand exposure to dust (including silica dust), fumes and chemicals such as form oil, grease, coal tar pitch and related petroleum products.Ability to hear with a high level of background noise (i.e. cranes, trucks).Visual acuity at short and long distances as well as good peripheral vision and depth perception (to perceive distance of moving objects, such as cranes and vehicles).Ability to perform moderate physical work, lifting and carrying weights of up to 25 lbs. regularly and up to 75 lbs. occasionally.Ability to access equipment at various levels by reaching or climbing a ladder.Ability to support oneself in an erect position and sit, stand and walk for extended periods of time.Ability to work under stress.Ability to work in extreme temperatures associated with the outdoors.Ability to operate a motor vehicle and travel to satellite facilities. Travel requirement is less than 10%.Management Expectations:Manage from the production floor, regularly visiting all work centers and being intimate with the manufacturing process. Take care of routine matters, such as paperwork, during non-production hours.Be present when production is taking place, including on weekends and early morning hours as necessary. Time commitment may average 50 hours or more per week at busy times.Approach the position with a sense of urgency, passion and a commitment to be the best.Lead change and collaboration. Motivate the team by being a positive, encouraging champion for continuous improvement and cost saving manufacturing initiatives.Act as a culture carrier for the Company, leading by example, treating others with dignity, respect and fairness and always managing within the context of the Philosophy Statement.Spend the time required to coach, mentor and teach direct reports and shop floor associates, helping them reach beyond their perceived potential.CONTACT:

title: PROJECT MANAGER III- POWER (T&D)
description: PROJECT MANAGER III- POWER (T&D)(Job Number: 190001EL)Building a career at Granite may be the most valuable thing you could do...Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to build your career and personal brand? If so, then you’ve come to the right place!Since 1922, Granite Construction has continued its long standing commitment to building some of America’s largest infrastructure projects including highways, bridges, dams, rail, and power. Recognized as one of the top 25 largest construction companies in the U.S., Granite specializes in complex infrastructure projects and provides award-winning construction services in mining, earthwork, water/sewer, power, tunneling, rail, highway and bridge construction. Granite also produces construction materials-sand, gravel, ready-mix, recycled asphalt product and asphalt concrete, and is a proven leader in alternative procurement project delivery.At Granite, our employees are our most valued asset and we are passionate about retaining, developing, and recruiting the best talent available. Our employees reflect our core values: Honesty, Integrity, Fairness, Accountability, Consideration of Others, Pursuit of Excellence, Reliability Safety and Citizenship and we are continuously looking for individuals who possess a winning attitude and share our Core Values. In exchange, we help you build a career that no other company can duplicate. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued. Add our award winning safety program, ethics, reputation, and a commitment to continuous improvement and you’ll see that we are building more than infrastructure—together, we are building your future.General SummaryThe Project Manager will be responsible for the overall direction, completion and financial outcome for complex industrial or heavy industrial EPC projects with a revenue range of $50 - $100 million with project durations up to 3 years. The ideal candidate will have previous experience with EPC/GC/CMGC/OE high voltage T&D construction, utility staff augmentation, material management, testing & commissioning, renewable power generation or civil engineering.Essential Job AccountabilitiesPerform accurate project revenue and cost financial forecasting to ensure corporate profitability goals are met.Manage a staff of up to 10 full-time employees including hiring, firing, and completing performance reviews.Coordinate with estimators and project controls group to establish budget.Lead estimating efforts on vertically integrated projects to ensure accurate and consistent bid to build process.Coordinate efforts with estimators, large project sponsor, and manager of construction to manage resources to meet project schedule.Participate in bid review and bid closing to ensure accuracy of bid and evaluate project feasibility; work with estimating team to develop bid schedule.Coordinate with large project sponsor, manager of construction and project team to develop comprehensive plan for project start up and successful kick-off.Provide environment where dynamic project communication occurs between Project Engineers, Foremen, Superintendents and Construction Manager to ensure work is accomplished in an efficient, profitable, and safe manner.Ensure proper job controls, i.e. quantities, costs, revenue and schedule.Establish and maintain working relationships with owners, agencies, subcontractors, inspectors, etc., providing customer service to develop long-term partnerships with client base.Ensure accurate construction reports for the job allowing for continuous improvement in performance.Run projects at profitability levels to meet or exceed expected margins.Comply, understand, and support corporate safety initiatives to ensure a safe work environment.EducationBS degree in Electrical or Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Business Administration, or related field or equivalent work experience in heavy civil construction.Work ExperienceMinimum of ten (10) year’s progressive project experience in EPC/GC/CMGC/OE high voltage T&D construction and substation environments.Experience as a Large Projects Superintendent preferred.Experience in Design-build projects preferred.Physical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit and use hands to operate a computer keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Subject to outside working conditions. At times will be working around large construction equipment, must be safety conscience.About Granite Construction IncorporatedGranite Construction Incorporated is a member of the S&P 400 Index and is the parent company of Granite Construction Company, one of the nation's largest heavy civil contractors and construction materials producers. Granite Construction is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities and a Drug-Free Workplace. For additional information on applicant/employee rights please click here.Notice to Staffing AgenciesGranite Construction, Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Granite") will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to Granite, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Granite mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Granite employees, or to Granite's resume database will be considered Granite property. Granite will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Granite will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. Agencies must obtain advance written approval from Granite's recruiting function to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract for service and in response to a specific job opening. Granite will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement in place. Agency agreements will only be valid if in writing and signed by Granite's Human Resources Representative or his/ her designee. No other Granite employee is authorized to bind Granite to any agreement regarding the placement of candidates by Agencies.Area of Interest ConstructionPrimary Location US-CA-SacramentoOther Locations US-IL-ChicagoSchedule Full-time

title: Arity-Data Scientist-Sr Manager
description: Founded by The Allstate Corporation in 2016, Arity is a data and analytics company focused on improving transportation. We collect and analyze enormous amounts of data, using predictive analytics to build solutions with a single goal in mind: to make transportation smarter, safer and more useful for everyone.At the heart of that mission are the people that work here—the dreamers, doers and difference-makers that call this place home. As part of that team, your work will showcase both your intelligence and your creativity as you tackle real problems and put your talents towards transforming transportation.That’s because at Arity, we believe work and life shouldn’t be at odds with one another. After all, we know that your unique qualities give you a unique perspective. We don’t just want you to see yourself here. We want you to be yourself here.The TeamAt Arity, our Analytics team is at the core of helping us transform mobility. They not only know how to analyze and find meaning within the data, but are passionate about how it affects the end-users of our products. They work with a treasure trove of massive data sets every day—after all, Arity is constantly collecting and deciphering billions of miles of driving data. And as our data continues to grow by the second, our Analytics teammates grow right alongside it. We give them the opportunity to model and visualize that data to create innovative products, working side-by-side with our diverse product teams. The insights uncovered by the Analytics team help catalyze groundbreaking solutions for our customers and are a driving force in making transportation smarter, safer, and more useful for everyone. Personally, we think that’s pretty game-changing stuff.The RoleAs a Senior Manager on the Data Science team, you will be responsible for leading and inspiring a world-class group of over twenty data scientists, data analytics engineers and business analytics consultants spread across several product development teams. You will empower data scientists to detect sophisticated driving behaviors on the edge, enrich driving routes with meaningful attributes, and develop an in-depth understanding of users’ mobility patterns. You will help us recruit and lead top talent and have a key voice in the analytics operations at Arity. This includes deploying models to mobile and cloud platforms. You will also help create and support our business strategy by being a strong voice of the customer from an analytics lens.Responsibilities:Be a servant leader for several data science managers engaged with cross-functional product development teams through coaching and mentoringHelp the Arity Product organization translate our strategic vision into roadmaps and priorities using data science expertisePlay a strong role in Arity’s ongoing management team discussions, where we evolve our strategy and tactics and address operational issuesSupport team efforts to enhance our culture and create strong professional development opportunitiesDrive continuous improvement of data science & data engineering practices and tools to create world-class capabilitiesSupport sales and customer success efforts by demonstrating our analytics maturity coupled with humility and empathyBuild the Arity brand by engaging in conferences, meetups, blogs and other external public engagementsDrive recruiting by leading efforts to build relationships in the industry, attend career fairs and create strong interviewing pipelinesQualificationsInspires/mentors/coaches people to be bold and do the best work of their careersExtensive data engineering or machine learning experience in a business contextDemonstrated ability to deliver results on complex, cross-functional projectsHighly innovative thought leaders who envision and articulate radical changeComfortable in a fast-paced environment with high ambiguity; inspires others to embrace these conditionsProven champions of agile product development practicesRespected by peers for their technical prowess as well as knowledge of architecture and deploymentExcellent interpersonal communicators / collaborators with both technical and non-technical team membersCompetitive with themselves while being humbleThe candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.That’s the day-to-day, now let’s talk about the rest of it. As we mentioned, Arity was founded by The Allstate Corporation. But you’ll be working for—and at—Arity. It’s the best of both worlds. You’ll get access to the full suite of Allstate benefits and work in a fast-paced startup culture. That’s more than just free breakfasts, brain breaks and ping pong. It’s a culture that encourages you to be you.Sound like a fit? Apply now! We can’t wait to meet you.Arity.com Instagram Twitter LinkedInAllstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component.For jobs in San Francisco, please click "here" for information regarding the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.For jobs in Los Angeles, please click "here" for information regarding the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.It is the policy of Allstate to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, disability, and citizenship status as a veteran with a disability or veteran of the Vietnam Era.

title: Manager, Cyber Security - Advanced Cyber Analytics Fraud Specialist
description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.KPMG is currently seeking a Manager in Cyber Secruity for our Consulting practice.Responsibilities:Collate data from multiple digital fraud and security tools for deeper threat insights using advanced analyticsApply a firm understanding of customer identify and access management, Security Monitoring and Incident Response methodology to improving security alert handling, automation, and enforcement capacities for KPMG's clientsUtilize and understand the common capacities of, and data available from, common security tools, including device profiling, behavioral biometrics, multi-factor authentication, voice analytics, including tools that implement the use of machine learning to reduce digital fraudAssist with scoping methodology, multi-factor authentication, application logging, account takeover prevention detection and response, web and mobile device security, and common understanding of IPs, ISPs, device indicators, and other customer identify toolsExperience in understanding threats, the current threat landscape, and intelligence gathering with an analytical mindset in order to translate data into paceApplicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the futureKPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. title: Maintenance & Facilities Manager
description: WE'RE LOOKING FORMaintenance & Facilities ManagerEmployment typeRegular / PermanentLocation5951 Clearwater DriveMinnetonka, MINNESOTA, 55343-8990United StatesReference Numberreq15510Who we are?With 90,000 people on five continents, SUEZ is a world leader in smart and sustainable resource management. We provide water and waste management solutions that enable cities and industries optimize their resource management and strengthen their environmental and economic performances.SUEZ Water Technologies & Solutions looks for innovation everywhere. For more than 100 years, SUEZ has been at the forefront of innovation, from the SUEZ Canal to addressing water scarcity. Finding solutions to the world's biggest problems has never been more important than right now. Join us today and become an essential part of the Resource Revolution!Who are we looking for?Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree (manufacturing or engineering discipline) or equitable experienceMin. 8+ years of hands-on operational leadership experience/leading a team and executing maintenance initiatives.Influencing and coaching skillsAbility to structure ambiguous problems, analyze complex processes, synthesize data and results, and drive toward insight and solutionsAble to identify significant deviations from the operating plan and budget and work with site leaders to identify corrective actions using appropriate continuous improvement tools (kaizen, visual systems, 5S, gemba, six sigma, LEANDesired Qualifications (a plus but not necessary)TPM, Reliability Center Maintenance experienceCapital planning experienceLean manufacturing experience is a plusWhat will you be doing?RESPONSIBILITIES:This position is responsible for the SUEZ Water Technologies Solutions, Minnetonka, MN manufacturing site’s Maintenance vision, strategy and execution. The Facility & Maintenance Manager will work to establish a world-class maintenance organization with superior asset reliability and uptime to enable a safer, more profitable and increasingly more competitive manufacturing site. By proactively pursuing improvement opportunities, making data-based decisions, establishing measurable and repeatable performance to maximize effective use of assets and assist the business in meeting agreed production, cost and improvement targets in a sustainable manner the individual in this role will help drive operational excellence. Will work in close partnership with the Reliability Engineer/Manager to execute an asset reliability program.Core Maintenance responsibilities:Drive safety first by setting the example and driving preventative measuresOversee team member training completion and complianceParticipate in EHS related actions, to improve safety in own areaManage all follow-up post-incident actions; including incident investigations, leading learning teams and site reportingDevelop and lead a site Vision & Mission for Maintenance with partnership of the operational teamsExecute a world-class, preventive/predictive maintenance framework and best-practices sitewideFoster a partnership culture with the operations teams focused on serving the site operations, implementing sustainable improvements to maximize machine uptime/Overall Equipment Efficiency and continuous improvement of maintenance practices and fundamentals.Maximize the maintenance teams’ operating efficiency, trouble-shooting, root-cause investigation, countermeasure implementation, preventive/predictive maintenance activities while contributing to internal projects as well.Plan timely execution of Preventative Maintenance with the Maintenance personnel.Manage the site maintenance budget (planning and execution of Maintenance Operational Plan)Oversight of facility contract management (HVAC, lawn care, supply etc.)Provide coaching and leadership for the Facility & Maintenance organization of about 20 + peopleEstablish and drive maintenance KPIs: Daily & Weekly schedule compliance, Preventive & Predictive Maintenance schedule compliance, backlog, wrench time/utilization, overtime, MTBF/MTTR, etc.Compensation: Annual 0.00 - 0.00 USDIs relocation for this position offered: YesNumber of Job Openings: 1Company Grade/Band: Lead ProfessionalSUEZ’s Water Technologies and Solutions (SWTS) offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation.WTS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Software Development Manager
description: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalentExperience leading a team of software engineers of six or more3+ years of experience managing software development teams, ideally with hands-on architectural and distributed systems experienceExperience with the tools of the trade, including a variety of modern programming languages (Java, JavaScript, C#, Objective C) and open-source technologiesExperience with software development principles and application of clear methodology in SDLCExperience with fullstack development and delivering web applications5+ years experience with object oriented developmentPassionate about building, owning and operating massively scalable systems? Experienced in building and leading teams of highly competent software engineers ranging from new graduates to seasoned managers and architects? Want to make a billion-dollar impact? If so, here is an opportunity tailored for you.Who are we?It’s no secret that Amazon relies on its technology to deliver millions of packages every day to its customers – on time, with low cost. Our Transportation Technology division builds the complex software solutions that work across our vendors, warehouses and carriers to optimize both time & cost of getting the packages delivered. Our services already handle thousands of requests per second, make business decisions impacting billions of dollars a year, integrate with a network of small and large carriers worldwide, manage business rules for millions of unique products, and improve ordering and delivery experience for millions of online shoppers. This remains a fast-growing business, and our technical journey has only started. With rapid expansion into new geographies, innovations in supply chain, unique delivery models for products ranging from Fresh groceries to big-screen TV’s, increasingly complex transportation network, and growing number of shipments worldwide, we see a brand new opportunity to fundamentally change the way people get the stuff they need, and make a big impact by cutting billions of dollars of transportation costs from our network. Our mission is to build the most efficient and optimal transportation system on the planet, using our engineering muscle as our biggest advantage. We aim to leverage cutting edge technologies in big data, machine learning, and optimization techniques, and operate high volume, low latency, and high availability services. Oh, and we will need great leaders too (this is where you come in … read on)What will you do?As part of the leadership team, you will work on developing the systems and strategies that will be used by Amazon worldwide and you will regularly interact with senior leadership. You will work with the business teams globally to define organization roadmaps, drive execution of technology projects, drive operational excellence initiatives and manage technology operations. You will manage and mentor a high-performing engineering team of 5-10 towards achieving a focused mission. You’ll work in fast paced ever changing environment and will lead not only at the strategic level, but also tactically day-to-day by diving deeply into business and technical domains.You are expected to have an established background in building highly scalable systems and system design, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment. You should be somebody who enjoys working on complex system software, is customer-centric, and feels strongly about building good software as well as making that software achieve its operational goals. Experience with building and operating web-based applications and/or web services-based applications, especially at large scale, will be very applicable and helpful.Come and see for yourself why we are one of the most admired company in the US, rated #1 in Innovation and # 1 in Customer Service, and be part of our tradition of working hard, having fun and making history7+ years of software development experience, including 5+ years as development managerPrior experience developing high quality, large scale consumer applicationsExperience building customer and developer facing products and servicesStrong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiencesA strong track record of project delivery for large, cross-functional, projectsAbility to work in a dynamic fast-paced environment

title: Senior Manager, Quality Assurance
description: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline10+ years of experience managing quality teams5+ years of experience of leading and delivering test frameworks and test toolsPassionate about owning Quality for operating massively scalable systems? If so, here is an opportunity tailored for you.Who are we?It’s no secret that Amazon relies on its technology to deliver millions of packages every day to its customers – on time, with low cost. Our Transportation Technology division builds the complex software solutions that work across our vendors, warehouses and carriers to optimize both time & cost of getting the packages delivered. Our services already handle thousands of requests per second, make business decisions impacting billions of dollars a year, integrate with a network of small and large carriers worldwide, manage business rules for millions of unique products, and improve ordering and delivery experience for millions of online shoppers. This remains a fast growing business, and our technical journey has only started. With rapid expansion into new geographies, innovations in supply chain, unique delivery models for products ranging from Fresh groceries to big-screen TV’s, increasingly complex transportation network, and growing number of shipments worldwide, we see a brand new opportunity to fundamentally change the way people get the stuff they need, and make a big impact by cutting billions of dollars of transportation costs from the ecosystem. Our mission is to build the most efficient and optimal transportation system on the planet, using our engineering muscle as our biggest advantage. We aim to leverage cutting edge technologies in big data, machine learning, and optimization techniques, and operate high volume, low latency, and high availability services.What will you do:The Senior Manager, Quality for MMPT is responsible for leading a team of Quality Assurance Managers, Quality Assurance Engineers, Software Development Engineers in Test and ensuring that our products built in Middle Mile Products and Technology meet the expectations of our customers. This responsibility begins early in our development phase, where the team investigates new processes and technologies that could impact the quality of the products, and mitigating these risks through the validation phases. This role is responsible for the successful roll out of the various products to our customers in all supported regions – NA, EU, JP, India and others. The Quality leader works with other cross-functional leaders from engineering, product management and operations throughout all aspects of their work. The successful candidate will establish quality goals and monitor performance with his team, investigating the full suite of failure analysis leading to root cause determination and subsequent closed loop corrective action. The Sr. Mgr. Quality leads his team through quality lesson’s learned and institutes remedies to prevent re-occurrence of quality issues and possess a high sense of urgency when managing critical issues.The Sr. Mgr, Quality will drive continuous improvement in all aspects of the job, deal with ambiguity, and influence at all levels of the company, including making quality assessments and risk appraisals to leadership team. As a senior leader, this role requires building a team of Quality Managers / Engineers and coaching their development to achieve high performance.In this role, you will:Lead Quality Managers, Sr. QA Engineers and SDETs having broad responsibility to hire and to build a high performing and capable teamCreate a vision for the team and set priorities aligned with the goals for the larger organizationUnderstand the technology and functionality of Middle Mile Products and Technology.Be an expert in advanced quality methods and protocol.Lead cross-functional teams in Design for Quality initiatives.Utilize your comprehensive knowledge of standards, related disciplines, company strategy and goals, to ensure a positive customer experience.Deliver solutions to complex problems through in-depth data analysis and forensics by using methodical approaches, along with experience, innovation and judgment to make decisions that may be based on partial information.Understand detailed implications of decisions and recommendations and be able to communicate recommended solutions to the product development team, all the way up through the executive leadership of the company.Align cross-functionally, influencing a broad spectrum of stakeholders to deliver on the quality policy.Create standards around which others will operate and build consensusCome and see for yourself why we are one of the most admired company in the US, rated #1 in Innovation and # title: Project Manager Intern
description: Are you looking for some great experience in industrial management along with some fun yet challenging work to complete your internship? Would your friends consider you a disciplined individual, able to take initiative and follow through on projects? Do you thrive in an environment dedicated to personal self-improvement, ongoing customer satisfaction, and a healthy dose of fun? If so, we want you on our team!CSI is looking to hire a driven and deliberate individual for the Project Manager Intern position. This role is primarily responsible for assisting project managers, engineers, and other technical support staff. You will assist project managers with the scope, design, and bidding of potential projects as well as assist and support of field installation crews.This role will require excellent people skills as you interact with internal staff, external customers, and vendors on a daily basis. You will have the opportunity to lead meetings and support the Installation Services department in estimating and project management duties. Providing assistance in the development of quotes and detailed project schedules and calculations will also fall under your purview. If you’re looking to quickly grow your management skills and industrial knowledge, this is the perfect job for you!About CSI:CSI provides state-of-the-art stainless steel process equipment and service to the food, dairy, beverage, pharmaceutical, and personal care industries. We are a growing company with a passion for providing superior customer service. Our work environment is rooted in respect, teamwork, continual learning, growth and community.We believe our employees are our greatest resource which is why we are committed to investing in our team. We enjoy hosting company luncheons, casual Fridays, and providing opportunities for volunteering in local community charitable events!Required SkillsRequired ExperienceEducation/TrainingPursuing Bachelor’s degree in industrial management or related degreeSkillsValid driver’s licenseComputer proficiency with word processing, spreadsheet and/or database, and AutoCADStandard work week will be 15-25 hours.This position requires the ability to interact with employees verbally and in writing, remain in a stationary position for 80% of the workday, have close visual acuity, and constantly operate a computer and other office productivity equipment, such as a phone, copy/fax/scan machine, computer keyboard and mouse with or without reasonable accommodation. This position also requires the ability to occasionally lift, stoop, bend, and lift office products and supplies, up to 20 pounds.CSI has a long standing policy of Equal Opportunity in employment. Our practice is to fill positions by selecting applicants who can perform the work in a competent and professional manner. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or individuals with disability. U.S. federal law requires completion of employment eligibility verification upon hire. CSI participates in E-Verify. Must have the right to work in the United States.

Must be able to collaborate with internal and external stakeholders via face to face, conference calls, and online meetings.Travel to project sites, or other APi Group company locations as needed.The employee will occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.Must be able to wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) in plant environment.PPE required when in the plant, yard or construction areas include:Hard HatSafety Glasses / GogglesSteel-toed BootsHigh Visibility VestHearing Protection (designated areas)GlovesPersonal Fall Arrest HarnessWe Offer:Medical, Dental, Vision, Life InsuranceLong-Term Disability401KPaid Time OffCompensation commensurate with experienceFor more than 100 years, Jamar has built a reputation as a solid partner delivering solid solutions. title: Regional Sales Manager - North Central (MN)
description: ***************About Vectra.ai***************Vectra.ai delivers a new class of advanced threat defense that delivers real-time detection and analysis of active network intrusions. Vectra technology picks up where perimeter security leaves off by providing deep, continuous analysis of both internal and Internet-facing network traffic to automatically detect all phases of a breach as attackers attempt to spy, spread, and steal within your network.Vectra directly analyzes network traffic in real time using a patent-pending combination of data science, machine learning, and behavioral analysis to detect attacker behaviors and user anomalies in the network. All detections are correlated and prioritized to show an attack in context, and Vectra Networks' machine learning adapts as attacks evolve.Position OverviewVectra is seeking self-starting, highly motivated sales professionals to join our Field Sales organization as a Regional Sales Manager (RSM). This sales professional will be responsible for all revenue within their territory location and have a proven track record of exceeding sales goals by selling into the larger enterprise. We are looking for a "Hunter"; someone who isn't afraid to knock down doors at the largest enterprises and has a structured/disciplined approach to pipeline development. This RSM will partner with our world class Sales Engineering team to own the sales process from start to finish, but will also leverage any/all corporate resources to ensure we win at all levels.This Regional Sales Manager will need to be passionate about the extraordinary value Vectra is providing to our customers while also conducting themselves with professionalism, honesty and integrity.ResponsibilitiesIdentify, cultivate and close new business sales relationships with enterprise accounts at an executive level within designated territory, this with CISO/CIO/CTO level contacts.Have a disciplined approach to pipeline development through leveraging Marketing, Channel partners, Customers, Sales Development team and their own ability to organically prospect.Develop an overall account strategy that will lead to a well-executed, team based selling effort.Team up with your Sales Engineer partner to deliver outstanding product demonstrations and well executed proof of concepts programs.Build a strong partnership with existing customers that focuses on customer retention, high renewal rates and expansion within the customer.Effectively forecast monthly/ quarterly revenue and communicate the status of strategic transactions to ensure you never win or lose alone.Strategic management of existing channel partners and development of new channel partners;3-4 days a week domestic travel (and sometimes international);Development of strategic business plans for territory on quarterly base.QualificationsMinimum 3+ years of Enterprise Sales experience exceeding quotas selling security, networking and/or software solutions.Hunter: you aren't afraid of cold-calling, breaking doors down to talk to the right people and own early stage pipeline development.A winner, someone who holds themselves accountable to consistent over-achievement.Successful experience closing complex Enterprise sales with multiple buying influencesExperience managing and closing deals of $200K+ as well high value transactions above $1m+.Experience establishing and fostering strong relationships with potential partners and customersAbility to demo products, working independently from Sales Engineers in first customer-meetingsStrong presentation and communications skills, translating technical features into business-valuesExperience with Salesforce.com is a plus.Outstanding verbal, written and presentation skillsComfortable working in a highly fast paced environment.Experience in consultative security fields; incident response, forensic investigations, threat intelligence, penetration testing, etc.Public speaking experience;Bachelor's degree preferred

title: PROJECT MANAGER I
description: PROJECT MANAGER I(Job Number: 2000013Y)Building a career at Granite may be the most valuable thing you could do...Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to build your career and personal brand? If so, then you’ve come to the right place!Since 1922, Granite Construction has continued its long standing commitment to building some of America’s largest infrastructure projects including highways, bridges, dams, rail, and power. Recognized as one of the top 25 largest construction companies in the U.S., Granite specializes in complex infrastructure projects and provides award-winning construction services in mining, earthwork, water/sewer, power, tunneling, rail, highway and bridge construction. Granite also produces construction materials-sand, gravel, ready-mix, recycled asphalt product and asphalt concrete, and is a proven leader in alternative procurement project delivery.At Granite, our employees are our most valued asset and we are passionate about retaining, developing, and recruiting the best talent available. Our employees reflect our core values: Honesty, Integrity, Fairness, Accountability, Consideration of Others, Pursuit of Excellence, Reliability Safety and Citizenship and we are continuously looking for individuals who possess a winning attitude and share our Core Values. In exchange, we help you build a career that no other company can duplicate. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued. Add our award winning safety program, ethics, reputation, and a commitment to continuous improvement and you’ll see that we are building more than infrastructure—together, we are building your future.General SummaryThis position is responsible for the overall direction, completion, and financial outcome of construction projects up to $15 million in size.Essential Job Accountabilities1. Perform accurate project revenue and cost financial forecasting to ensure corporate profitability goals are met.2. Coordinate with estimators and project controls group to establish budget.3. Lead estimating efforts on vertically integrated projects to ensure accurate and consistent bid to build process.4. Coordinate efforts with estimators, large project sponsor, and manager of construction to manage resources to meet project schedule.5. Participate in bid review and bid closing to ensure accuracy of bid and evaluate project feasibility; work with estimating team to develop bid schedule.6. Coordinate with large project sponsor, manager of construction and project team to develop comprehensive plan for project start up and successful kick-off.7. Provide environment where dynamic project communication occurs between Project Engineers, Foremen, Superintendents and Construction Manager to ensure work is accomplished in an efficient, profitable, and safe manner.8. Ensure proper job controls, i.e. quantities, costs, revenue and schedule.9. Establish and maintain working relationships with owners, agencies, subcontractors, corporate management, inspectors, etc., providing customer service to develop long-term partnerships with client base.10. Ensure accurate construction reports for the job allowing for continuous improvement in performance.11. Run projects at profitability levels to meet or exceed expected margins.12. Comply, understand, and support corporate safety initiatives to ensure a safe work environment.EducationBS degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Business Administration, or related field or equivalent work experience in heavy civil construction.Work ExperienceThree (3) to five (5) years progressive project experience in heavy civil environments.Minimum of five (5) years experience in paving, dirt, and grading in either private or public environments.Knowledge, skills, and abilitiesKnowledge of construction paving, underground, concrete and grading practices.Knowledge and understanding of union agreements and prevailing wage issues.Maintain ability to work in high production environment.Demonstrated decision-making skills.Excellent leadership skills.Excellent supervisory communication and organizational skills.Accuracy at all times.Physical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit and use hands to operate a computer keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Subject to outside working conditions. At times will be working around large construction equipment, must be safety conscience.Additional Requirements/SkillsAbility to abide by Granite’s Code of Conduct on a daily basis.A team player.About Granite Construction IncorporatedGranite Construction Incorporated is a member of the S&P 400 Index and is the parent company of Granite Construction Company, one of the nation's largest heavy civil contractors and construction materials producers. Granite Construction is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities and a Drug-Free Workplace. For additional information on applicant/employee rights please click here.Notice to Staffing AgenciesGranite Construction, Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Granite") will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to Granite, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Granite mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Granite employees, or to Granite's resume database will be considered Granite property. Granite will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Granite will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. Agencies must obtain advance written approval from Granite's recruiting function to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract for service and in response to a specific job opening. Granite will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement in place. Agency agreements will only be valid if in writing and signed by Granite's Human Resources Representative or his/ her designee. No other Granite employee is authorized to bind Granite to any agreement regarding the placement of candidates by Agencies.Area of Interest ConstructionPrimary Location US-NV-ElkoSchedule Full-time

title: Engineering Manager, Distributed Systems, Geolocation
description: Who we Are:The Geo team owns Twitter’s notion of user’s locations, points of interest, and places at Twitter. We work with large datasets and high traffic systems while protecting our user’s privacy.We build and maintain large-scale distributed systems and tools to automate and simplify our current Geo operations, including ingestion pipelines, location calculations, and other user facing improvements to our Geo systems.What You’ll Do:You will hire engineers and grow a nascent, distributed team to build it into a high performing team of diverse, smart, and driven engineers. You will take a team that currently owns many tools and services and streamline its operations to help the team deliver on its highest-value and high priority commitments. You will partner with product management and your technical leads to build a high-value roadmap of innovation for your team.You will lead by example to build your organizational culture in keeping with Twitter’s culture. You will partner with technical leads and guide engineers with your technical expertise by contributing to design reviews and ideation. You will mentor, coach and grow people.A successful engineering manager will:Lead a team of talented software engineers who like to ship code and tackle hard engineering and scalability problems.Build cohesive, high-functioning team that thrive in a culture of trust, respect, and inclusion.Balance autonomy with guidance by giving your team the tools, context, confidence, and motivation to make decisions effectively and independently.Have the technical capacity to partner with tech leads and be comfortable diving into the fray to help drive resolution in the case of incidents.Take responsibility for the team’s short-term and long-term strategy. Define the team's roadmap, success metrics, and priorities in close collaboration with other engineering teams and multi-functional partners.Maintain a balance between building sustainable, high-impact projects and shipping things quickly.Own your team’s deliverables and ensure we develop scalable, highly-available infrastructure that enables product engineers to experiment and rapidly iterate on products that delight our users and customers.Work closely with the Twitter recruiting team to hire high-potential candidates from diverse backgrounds.Project Examples:Design and implement high performance algorithms to store and query geospatial data efficientlyAutomate data ingestion with quality measurementsConsolidate user’s location settings in the app and develop a coherent strategy for technical implementationMigrate tools to the cloud from on prem data centers﻿Who you areYou have experience leading engineers at all levels and you’re skilled at coaching and guiding your directs through their career development.You believe in building both teams and systems that scale.You have a customer and impact focussed mindset in building softwareYou have a technical background with experience in building libraries and systems that work on large data sets, and are able to contribute to planning and design discussions. Experience with supporting large scale distributed systems in a production environment is a definite plus.You welcome the challenge of defining a strong charter and can partner with product management and tech leads to effectively create a compelling roadmap of innovation for your teamYou have a collaborative working style with a strong focus on disciplined execution and results.You like to ground decisions in data and reasoning and solve root causes of problems rather than surface issues.You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.You look ahead to identify opportunities and foster a culture of inclusion and innovation.You are comfortable managing a distributed team.You understand cost of software development / tech debt and long-term maintenanceRequirements:BS in Computer science; MS or PhD or equivalent work experience a plus.5+ years of hands-on software development experience building large-scale distributed systems. Experience with data products and/or machine learning is a plus.5+ years of experience managing development teams of 7 or more engineers building complex production grade software systems.Experience driving impact through cross-functional leadership.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.Experience building large scale systems and microservicesExperience managing engineers in remote locations is a plusEqual Opportunity StatementWe are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

title: Site Maintenance Manager (Rancho Belago, CA)

Founded by Gunter KNAPP over 60 years ago, the company remains a close knit, privately held company with strong values, diversity and a commitment to the environment and community in all our locations.As a leading-edge solutions provider known for its innovation, development and adoption of modern technologies, KNAPP provides one-stop, custom-designed intralogistics solutions in health care, retail, apparel, food, manufacturing and ecommerce sectors. title: Product Manager
description: At Snapdocs, we are on a mission to disrupt the real estate closing process with efficiency and transparency, so that lenders can close their loans sooner and homebuyers can move into their dream homes quicker. As a Product Manager, you will be a key part of our success by developing major product initiatives and strategy that impact our business, customers, and home buyers. A great product manager accelerates the whole company by being a strong advocate for users and an expert in their domain. You’ll bring products to market that accelerate our growth and bring significant value to our customers. We expect you to balance different perspectives and help us find an unambiguous path forward about what to build and when. If that sounds exciting, read on...Snapdocs is an early-stage technology platform, backed by blue-chip venture capital firms like Founders Fund, SV Angels, Sequoia Capital, F-Prime Capital and Y Combinator. We are tackling the trillion dollar U.S. mortgage market, developing modern software for an industry that still relies on fax machines and manila envelopes. We bring security, efficiency, and ultimately a better home buying experience to a paper-based pillar of the US economy. As we expand our product offering and tackle a broader swath of customers, we need to grow our team with smart, hungry, and curious people. That’s where you come in...You will build a product that delights our customers and directly impacts our success as a company. Establish a shared vision across the company by building consensus and proactive communication on priorities leading to product execution. Drive product development day-to-day by embedding within teams of engineers and designers and leading cross-functional groups together to bring those solutions to market. The product team is focused on maximizing the value we provide to our customers by creating a frictionless and secure experience for all users on the platform.Our ideal candidate will have a passion for technology with 3-5 years of experience as a Product Manager on a scrappy, innovative, and agile team. You should have experience shipping products from concept to launch and be comfortable working in an ambiguous environment. You can think in terms of the big picture, but also get your hands dirty with whatever it takes to ship products and features successfully - from QA testing to supporting customers. You know how to research topics, using both quantitative and qualitative methods to figure out what we need to build - and when. You know how and when to be scrappy in our growth stage startup environment. Bonus points for having experience working with API’s or Machine Learning technologies. Additional bonus points for experience working in a company that is creating network effects in their business model!Snapdocs’ culture is one that strongly values diversity and drive. We want to work with people of different backgrounds and different paths in life, and we trust our team members to make smart decisions. This means we value independent work as well as collaboration. We provide excellent benefits (including a 10 year exercise window on your options (!)) and our location in the heart of the Financial District in SF is super convenient.
skills: ['A/B Testing', 'Agile', 'Application Programming Interface (API)', 'Business Model', 'Closing', 'Collaboration', 'Communication', 'Machine Learning', 'Market', 'Network', 'Platform', 'Product Development', 'QA Testing', 'Quality Assurance (QA)', 'Real Estate', 'Research', 'Security', 'TestNG', 'Venture Capiral', 'Venture Capital (VC)', 'Windows']

title: Sr. Product Manager (Machine Learning)- Home Timeline Ranking
description: By applying for this role, you could choose to work in the following locations:San FranciscoNew York CityJob description:We are looking for an extraordinary product leader to help build the future of Twitter’s Home Timeline. As the product lead for Home Ranking, you will help define our strategy and roadmap to ensure that content on Home is personalized and content is ranked based on user preferences. You’ll work with a cross-functional team of engineers, data scientists, and researchers to launch new features for hundreds of millions of customers.If you are customer-obsessed, a creative and analytical thinker, and seek the thrill of making a massive impact on core user experience on Twitter, this role is for you!Who We Are:Our company's purpose is to serve the public conversation. The Home team helps serve that conversation by making it easy for people to find and join the best conversations as they unfold. This team owns machine learning systems that power Tweet ranking - ensuring that our customers see great, healthy content. This is a product that is core to Twitter’s continued success - surfacing the best content for our users where and when they want it most.What You’ll Do:Build deep understanding of our different types of customers and their needs that Home can serveIdentify opportunities for our product to better serve those customer needs and work with data science, research and engineering partners to craft, test, and launch new product featuresSet the pace for shipping world-class product features that delight our customers and contribute to our company’s most important goalsWho You Are:Obsessed with building products people loveYou have a solid understanding of engineering, familiarity with machine learning and data science, and technical depth that lets you understand and earn the respect of world-class engineers.You have experience with machine learning, ranking/relevance systems, and experimentationYou have a creative and entrepreneurial spirit, are a self starter and an analytical thinker.5+ years experience in product managementB.S in Computer Science (or related discipline)

title: Senior Product Manager - Network Security - Threat
description: The Business EntityCisco Security Business Group (SBG) develops best-in-class content and network security products and leads the market in firewall, intrusion prevention, remote access, and content security technologies.The TeamThe team you’ll be joining is in charge of the Cisco Firepower and ASA network security portfolio. Cisco is a long-time market leader in threat and firewall technologies, and as such has the greatest captive base of customers in the market. It’s a unique opportunity to work with a world-class team in a fast-growing entrepreneurial environment, while leveraging one of the largest portfolios of security technologies to create and deliver new offerings. This position is based in Fulton, MD or San Jose, CAWho You AreAs a Product Manager, you enjoy thinking through what it takes to build a world-class product, you know how to communicate that to engineering, you know how to see it through a successful launch, communicate it to sales and generate market impact and customer adoption. You love technology, and you love the business side of it even more. You may have been an engineer before, but the engineering you do now is in business: you passionately engineer your business and your product’s growth in the market. In this position, you will help run the network security business by driving the right features in the product you own, take on interesting business projects arising from customer, channel and platform opportunities and challenges. It will be your responsibility as a Product Manager that we agree on the right strategy for the role your product plays in the portfolio, as well as that we execute plans for your product so that it delivers on the strategy.Are you looking for the next challenge to sink your teeth into? We’d love to hear from you.What You'll Do Become an authority in your space. Our Product Managers work directly with customers to understand the space your product is in, personas using it and buying it, and ecosystem in which it operates. Conduct market analysis, competitive analysis and translate it to product direction. Identify and present innovative and creative product and business solutions that help your business and deliver on our strategy. Gather and synthesize requirements to define compelling product. Validate requirements and resulting product features with customers to ensure success. Broker and facilitate product decisions cross-functionally. Be able to balance business and user needs with technical constraints - discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative approaches, and lead and inspire engineering efforts to meet targets. Work with the broader Product Management team to design effective GTM strategies, work cross-functionally to have them implemented Partner with sales and SE teams for effective introduction of product into the market Maintain solid understanding of relevant technologies, contribute as a thought leader in the security industry. Produce case studies, white papers, presentations, and other materials to help evangelize the product.Minimum Qualifications Solid experience with threat-related security technologies and functions, including one or more of: IPS Advanced Malware Anti-virus Web or email security Threat intelligence/threat research SIEM Threat Analytics Experience with cloud/SAAS applications 6+ years of product management experience with successful products/services in security, infrastructure, networking or a related software field; 10+ in industry. Bachelor’s degree required (Computer science or related specialty preferred), MBA preferred. Solid experience in an Agile development environment.Other important traits: Bias for action Strong communication and teamwork skills. Self-starter with high levels of initiative, dedication and energy who can galvanize the team to follow. Familiarity with the needs of medium and large enterprise IT/Sec customers and GTM to those segments. Experience with pricing Experience with new product introduction Ability to work on multiple projects, set priorities and meet deadlines.We Are Cisco#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it.We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool.#LI-JS1#LI-PRIORITY

title: Program Manager, Labeling Operations
description: Waymo is the self-driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to move around. Building on software and sensor technology developed at Google, Waymo is now launching the world’s first fully self-driving transportation service that will take members of the public from A to B at the touch of a button.As its name suggests, our Engineering Operations team plays a vital role in the creation and development of Waymo's self-driving technology. Software Quality, Labeling and Mapping Operations are all part of this team: we review critical events, flag problematic cases, build sets of labeled data for machine learning, and make sure our high-definition maps are extraordinarily accurate.In this Program Manager role you'll:Ensure readiness and success of all labeling queues and workflows by acting as a bridge between MTV engineering teams and labeling operations (both vendor managed in HYD and partners in the US)Owner of labeling policies. This requires solid understanding of the engineering and operational implications of policy detailsOwning relationship and contracting with US based labeling vendors, including defining commercial terms and running of regular business reviewsCoordinating the creation of golden sets that are used to ensure operators meet labeling quality standardsTravel to Hyderabad, India required ~3 times annually to develop strong understanding of ops workflowsAt a minimum we’d like you to have:BA/BS degree in technical, or business discipline, or equivalent practical experience3+ years project/program management experienceStrong technical abilities - able to work closely with software engineersExcellent project manager with the ability to work independently and on multiple initiatives at the same timeStrong communication and presentation skills - can explain complicated topics and ideas in a clear and concise mannerDetail oriented, versatile, innovative, self-motivated team player with a positive attitudeIt’s preferred if you have:Experience with vendor operations, preferably including outsourced operations and/or contractingAdvanced Google Docs/Sheets skills, and experience with internal Google toolsExperience with creation of documentation for non-technical operatorsAbility to stay calm under pressure and sense of humour is always appreciated

title: Engineering Manager
description: By applying for this role, you could choose to work in the following locations:New York CitySan FranciscoAre you an engineering leader who’s passionate about defending online users against abuse, spam, and manipulation? Will you be proud to lead a team working on a real-time, scalable system that enables Machine Learning models to perform millions of detections? If so, you should join us. Health is Twitter’s top priority and we need your help!Who We AreThe mission of the Health organization at Twitter is to keep our users safe from negative experiences in a highly adversarial environment. This aligns with our company's #1 priority: growing the collective health, openness, and civility of public conversation.The Health ML Infrastructure engineering team is responsible for the platform powering Twitter’s ability to detect unhealthy content and interactions at an unprecedented scale. We work on some of the world’s most highly-scaled distributed systems, handling hundreds of millions of tweets and engagements each day. Our platform generates and provides access to a rich set of signals that feed into Machine Learning models to automatically detect harmful content and behaviors. In turn, each product surface at Twitter relies on our platform to keep their users safe.What You’ll DoWe look for someone who can lead teams of diverse, smart, distributed (across multiple geos), and driven engineers. We need leaders who take active roles in shaping the future of Twitter engineering while embodying our core values. A successful engineering manager will:Lead a team of talented engineers who like to ship code and tackle hard engineering and scalability problems.Build cohesive, high-functioning teams that thrive in a culture of trust, respect, and inclusion.Balance autonomy with guidance by giving your teams the tools, context, confidence, and motivation to make decisions effectively and independently.Have the technical capacity to partner with tech leads and be comfortable diving into the fray to help drive resolution in the case of incidents.Take responsibility for the group’s short-term and long-term strategy. Define the team's roadmap, success metrics, and priorities in close collaboration with other engineering teams and multi-functional partners.Maintain a balance between building sustainable, high-impact projects and shipping things quickly.Own your team’s deliverables and ensure we develop scalable, highly-available infrastructure that enables product engineers to experiment and rapidly iterate on products that delight our users and customers.Work closely with the Twitter recruiting team to hire high-potential candidates from diverse backgrounds.Who You AreYou have experience leading engineers at all levels and you’re skilled at coaching and guiding your directs through their career development.You believe in building both teams and infrastructure that scale.You have a technical background with experience in distributed systems, and are able to contribute to planning and design discussions. Experience with supporting online serving of Machine Learning models in a production environment is a definite plus.You have a collaborative working style with a strong focus on disciplined execution and results.You like to ground decisions in data and reasoning and solve root causes of problems rather than surface issues.You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.You look ahead to identify opportunities and foster a culture of innovation.We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status.San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
