title: Software Development Manager
description: 7+ years of relevant engineering experience3+ years of people management experience, managing engineersExperience in partnering with product and program management teamsBachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical fieldProven experience in project management of complex deliverables with limited resourcesExperience in hiring and developing engineering talentExperience with big data technologies such as Spark, Amazon EMR, Amazon Redshift and Amazon AthenaKnowledge of professional software engineering practices and the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operationsExcellent interpersonal communication and strong verbal and written English skillsKnowledge of statistical analysis and/or machine learningExperience in collaborating with or managing data science teams.Amazon’s Advertising Analytics and Insights (A&I) team is looking for a motivated and experienced Software Development Manager to own and lead a new and growing insights team within our organization. We are a startup within one of the fastest growing and most strategic parts of Amazon. Analytics & Insights owns the product, technology and deployment roadmap for advanced analytics and insights products across our advertiser success team. Advertiser success is core to Amazon’s growth, as it helps our suppliers drive awareness, consideration, and purchase of their products by hundreds of millions of consumers around the world, and generates revenue which helps us lower prices and invest in improvements to our customer experience. We are a highly motivated, collaborative and fun-loving team with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.As an engineering manager for A&I in New York, you will manage and grow a new engineering team. You will hire software engineers, coach individuals, lead your team, and act as single-threaded owner of the insight products that your team builds. You will own technical vision and direction, identify and mitigate risks, construct project schedules, communicate status, and embrace quantitative performance measures. You’ll build and maintain strong relationships between engineering and partner disciplines (Product, User Experience, QA) to ensure that we're delivering the right product for customers.You are a customer-obsessed technical leader with sharp business acumen and a track record of building and growing engineering teams. You ship software and own the day-to-day maintenance and evolution of systems that serve the needs of our large and growing base of advertisers. We are looking for a leader who can thrive in a startup environment, thinks big, can move fast, and wants to change the way customers use data to drive business success. If you are passionate about creating the future, come join us as we work hard, have fun, and make history.Graduate-level degree in computer science or related technical fieldDeep hands-on technical expertiseFamiliarity with scalable ML implementation and analytics programming languages on large data stores (10s of TBs per analysis instance)Experience with Agile software development, for example Scrum or KanbanExperience in advertising technologyAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. title: Sr. Group Engineering Manager/Software Development - Demand Forecasting
description: Experience in partnering with product and program management teams5+ years of people management experience, managing engineers10+ years of relevant engineering experienceBS in Computer Science, Mathematics or equivalent with at least 10 years of industry experience.At least 6 years of experience managing enterprise software engineering teams.Technically credible to lead a team of world class software engineers and development managers and be able to deliver the right product with a scalable engineering design.The ability to achieve results in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment is critical.A passion for people management and mentorship; hiring and developing great peopleAble to balance technical leadership with sound business judgment.Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technologies team is looking for a passionate, results-oriented, inventive, and technical leader to lead our efforts in building the next generation forecasts for the 100’s of millions of products sold on Amazon worldwide. The team’s charter is to create the machine learning and software platforms that supports various demand forecasting models. We enable billions of dollars of goods flowing through Amazon supply chain, while leading the way of providing elastic fulfillment solutions beyond traditional Fulfillment Centers. The team owns massively scalable and distributed systems that support retail business, supplier interaction, capacity planning, and operations.The successful candidate is one who thrives in a fast-paced environment, has a strong understanding of core software development, algorithmic concepts and is comfortable working in a hybrid technical/science team. The candidate is passionate about technology and wants to solve real business problems. We have a team culture that encourages innovation and expect developers and management alike to take high degree of ownership for the product vision, technical architecture and project delivery. Responsibilities include direct management of software engineers and managers, improvements in process and quality of service, strategic planning, project management, and management of resources across teams. You will act as a leader who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. You are proactive in removing roadblocks, pave the way for innovation, and can handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment. You are an experienced software development leader who understands and sets a high bar for all parts of the software development and deployment lifecycle, including design, development, documentation, testing and operations. You work hand-in-hand with business partners, understand their needs and are able to translate business necessities into value-added features. You are able to handle business escalations with a data-driven approach.Key Responsibilities:Foster culture of continuous engineering improvement through mentoring, feedback, and metricsOwn and champion engineering and operational excellence through establishment of group-wide metrics for measurement with a consistent, regular process for assessment and improvementInterface with a diverse customer base to understand requirements, priorities, and processesSet clear, measurable quality goals for an organization in a data-driven wayHave the obsession to drive a better customer experience through everything that we do here at AmazonBring innovative ideas to the table every day, in order to find better ways of accomplishing our customer objectivesRaise the bar on functionality, flow, consistency, usability, and simplicity continually; guard the world-class supply chain experience at AmazonMentor and promote your team membersMS or PhD in Computer ScienceExperience with analytics and large data setsExperience with forecastingExperience building machine learning applications

title: Reliability Engineering Manager
description: Argo AI was founded to tackle one of the most challenging applications in computer science, robotics and artificial intelligence with self-driving vehicles. Argo AI is developing and deploying the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and computer vision to help build safe and efficient self-driving vehicles that enable these transformations and more. The challenges are significant, but we are a team that believes in tackling hard, meaningful problems to improve the world.We are building a high-performance team that is excited by complex engineering challenges and is passionate about making transportation safer, more affordable, and accessible for all. Vehicle Operations' essential function at Argo is to safely execute the test and road operations initiatives set forth by our engineering team. Vehicle Operations consists of a team of experts who understand Argo's underlying vehicle technology and programs. The team then uses that information to effectively manage efforts to meet our mileage and performance goals. These programs will provide detailed feedback to our engineering team on how our vehicles are performing.The Operational Reliability Engineering Team is responsible for ensuring the Autonomous Vehicle and various Supporting Software Systems are functioning properly and at maximum efficiency. This includes working with our discipline and responsible engineers to ensure vehicle platform, hardware components, communication networks, data management systems, and software product suites are continually working together to deliver a high-performance Autonomous Vehicle. The Reliability Team is instrumental in triaging reported Production Software issues as well as maximizing fleet uptime of vehicles and supporting Hardware resources at all Argo AI Vehicle Operations locations. As issues arise during any of our operations, the Reliability Engineering Team will be responsible for diagnosing, documenting, tracking, and reporting a wide variety of both Software and Hardware issues through to resolution.What you'll do:Manage the day to day effort and long term vision of the Reliability Engineering TeamDiagnosing issues being reporting from our Operations and Supporting title: Engineering Manager (Machine Learning)
description: By applying for this role, you could choose to work in the following locations:San FranciscoSeattleWho We Are:Twitter is looking for an engineering leader to oversee quality for the home timeline. The team’s mission is to show users the content they care about. We build relevance and machine learning models and systems to power the core of the Twitter product. Every time users see new tweets we evaluate candidates from the nearly half a billion daily tweets to select, organize and deliver the best timeline. The recent products and technologies built by our team have shown consistent results in driving retention and are some of largest contributors of engagements on the platform.What You’ll Do: You will join the Timelines Quality team and lead a world-class team of Machine Learning and backend engineers. We’re looking for a hands-on, technical manager with a real passion for working on user-facing products. The ideal candidate would be equally comfortable guiding the development of models to rank tweets and predict engagement, whiteboarding new product ideas with designers and product managers, or brainstorming ways to efficiently index and serve tweets with systems engineers.Who You Are:You have a background in machine learning, ideally prediction/binary classification, logistic regression, decision trees, deep learning techniquesYou have familiarity with A/B experiments and metricsYou have enthusiasm for experiment and metrics-driven iterative product developmentYou can hold your own technically with engineers on the team and give constructive feedback on projects and ideasYou have a sense of urgency, move quickly and ship thingsYou can partner with other leads from engineering, product and design to craft a roadmap and measures of successYou can be a bold source of engineering talent and will be comfortable closing candidatesRequirements:BA/BS or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)Previously tech-led or managed a team of 5 or more engineers building ML models and systems in a production settingAt Twitter, we have a bold aspiration to reach every person on the planet. We believe that goal is more attainable with a team that understands and represents different cultures and backgrounds. Twitter is committed to providing equal employment and advancement opportunities to everyone, regardless of their race, color, ancestry, gender, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, Veteran or any other legally protected status.San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Quality Manager
description: Imagen is extending the frontiers of medicine and artificial intelligence (AI) to improve human well-being. In the short term, we are building state-of-the-art AI software to reduce diagnostic errors in radiology and improve patient outcomes. Over the long term, we are transforming early disease identification and management through our interdisciplinary research at the intersection of medicine and AI.We're a team of leading scientists, engineers, clinicians, and industry professionals from some of the top healthcare and technology organizations across the globe. Our clinical team is comprised of radiologists and surgeons from Mayo Clinic, Stanford Hospital, Hospital for Special Surgery, Boston Children's Hospital, and others. Imagen's technical team is comprised of machine learning PhDs and engineers with extensive experience doing research and building technology and products at world-class organizations.We were founded in 2016 and have raised $60M from leading venture capitalists, hospitals and health systems, and technology entrepreneurs. Our institutional investors include DFJ and GV.We're looking for a Quality Manager to ensure compliance to 21 CFR Part 820 through the implementation and maintenance of our Quality Management System (QMS). As a Quality Manager, you will be a leader in the development of new procedures, creating novel approaches to V&V in the world of machine learning, and adapting agile software engineering practices to fit the regulated world of Medical Devices. Our ideal candidate is someone with direct experience in oversight and strategy of quality assurance activities to ensure compliance with applicable regulatory requirements.Responsibilities:Provide proactive quality support for process improvement and drive the development and maintenance of documentation to maintain compliance with FDA regulations and ISO 13485Collaborate with the R&D organization to help facilitate the successful execution of design control deliverables including participation in design reviews, reviewing & approving design verification & validation activities, and creating protocols & requirements for IQ / OQ / PQ.Foster a quality culture focused on meeting high quality, ethical and compliance standardsBuild, execute and monitor an effective internal audit programManage post-market lifecycle processes for our products, including complaint handlingQualifications:Mission-driven and passionate about improving healthcare outcomes4+ years of experience in Quality and FDA / ISO 13485 compliant software developmentStrong familiarity with the software engineering lifecycle and QA methodologyDetail and execution oriented, with the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writingThis role is based in New York, NY.

With over 1,000,000 appointments already booked with us, we're expanding our wellness services to even more homes, businesses, and spas across the United States.We are seeking an exceptional Product Manager to drive the product strategy, execution and technical re-engineering of our B2B product lines. title: Product Manager - Compliance
description: Plano 2 (31062), United States of America, Plano, TexasAt Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Product Manager - ComplianceCapital One is a diversified bank that offers a broad array of financial products and services to consumers, small business and commercial clients. Ranked #127 on the Fortune 500, Capital One has one of the most widely recognized brands in America. As one of the nation’s top 10 banks, we offer a broad spectrum of financial products and services to consumers, small businesses and commercial clients. We nurture a work environment where people with a variety of thoughts, ideas and backgrounds, guided by our shared Values, come together to make Capital One a great company and a great place to work.At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.The Compliance Innovation Team is dedicated to enabling Financial Services and Fair & Responsible Banking Compliance programs through expanding existing capabilities and creating new transformative solutions. Product Managers play a critical role in achieving transformation. As a product manager within the Compliance Innovation Team you will be working with program leaders to relentlessly push to understand customer needs in order to discover and shape new product and analytical capabilities across all areas of Financial Service and Fair & Responsible Banking Compliance. As a Product Manager, you will help develop and lead new in-house product development and on any given day you will be challenged to collaborate with designers, engineers, data scientists and analysts to execute the product strategy- develop, launch, and enhance products and services while managing a broad set of relationships within Compliance, Operational Risk and Tech solution providers.Responsibilities:Execution: Manage and sequence delivery of business intent, build business requirements and execute against the product strategy. Oversee multiple projects concurrently leading road mapping backed by strong customer problems articulation, defined Objective and Key Results (OKRs), story writing, testing, and product roll-out strategyStrategic & analytic orientation: A proven track record of decision making and analytically based problem solving. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative & technology orientation, given that a large part of the Compliance is based on rigorous analytic risk management. Regularly and systematically use data to uncover opportunities, track product performance, and drive decision making.Clear results orientation: display an intense focus on achieving both short- and long-term goals in an Agile framework. Testing and iterating in small-scale pilots to validate concepts, refine them to achieve product-program fit, and then scale to drive vertical and horizontal economics across Compliance Teams. Be experienced in human-centered product discovery methods such as design thinking and service designPartnership: Work closely with colleagues across Capital One including: Tech/IT, Compliance, Operational Risk and Line of Business teams to drive improvement in risk mitigation.Solid people leadership and collaboration experience: Ability to build and leverage the capabilities of a high-performing cross functional/cross locational teams to foster innovation, drive critical decisions, hold partners accountable, and be able to consistently deliver results. Establish or participate in Design Thinking, Agile, and LEAN rituals which establish rhythm for the team, promote ongoing communication, and iterative refinement of roadmapsStrong executive communication skills: Strong written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skillsSuccessful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and dynamic environmentPrioritize, negotiate and remove blockers to orchestrate successful launch or optimization cycleExperience with Risk Management, Cloud based application design, Machine Learning, AI, or other emerging technologiesBasic Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree or military experienceAt least 2 year of experience as product manager of one or more sprint teamsPreferred Qualifications:At least 5 years of product management experienceAt this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position

title: Software Development Manager
description: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science5+ years experience in software development.2+ years management experience.The Selection Economics team owns systems that optimize the selection of items that Amazon offers its customers worldwide so as to maximize long term free cash flow for Amazon. These systems continuously evaluate the economics of millions of items as part of the selection decision, handling more than a million requests per second and making business decisions worth billions of dollars each year. With rapid expansion into new geographies, increasing complexity of supply chain and expanding selection of products, the Selection Economics team has the opportunity to build software solutions that scale and propel the business through industry-leading technological innovations. Solutions to the problems in this space are at the cross-section of core engineering, distributed systems, machine learning, operations research and econometrics.Selection Economics is part of Amazon's Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) organization that owns cutting edge technologies that optimize Amazon's supply chain worldwide so that customers can get the items they need, at the right speed and price. Watch this video to learn more about our organization, SCOT: http://bit.ly/amazon-scotAs the leader of the Selection Economics team, you will lead a team of strong and high performing software engineers, product managers, business intelligence engineers and scientists. You will partner with business and technical teams across Amazon to identify new opportunities to offer Amazon customers the broadest selection while doing so in an economically efficient way, researching new models and existing model applications to scale and improve Amazon's selection offering. You will also focus on the correctness of your models, and will design innovative ways to validate and gain insights from the details of your systems' outputs. This position has high-level visibility with senior leaders across Amazon.Responsibilities includeDeveloping and driving product vision and roadmapPrioritization and planning of projects and features, working with business and technical stakeholders worldwideLeading the team to drive innovative research solutions to drive long term free cash flow for AmazonContribute to documents presented to senior leadersIdentify new metrics for system performance and financial impact; launch self-service capabilities for driving business intelligenceMonitoring, validation, and operation of production servicesCareer management and development of reportsMaster of Science in Computer Science.Experience leading research-oriented software development teams.Understanding of system architecture and experience with large distributed systems. Experience in forecasting, machine learning, or operations research.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.

title: Sr. Manager, Payments Machine Learning and Data Science
description: Basic Qualifications5+ years experience defining a product vision and long-term strategy for a technical productEarn trust with peers, both tech and non-tech, and communicate openlyProfessional or academic writing skillsDemonstrated ability to attract top talent and build a teamThe Sr. Manager, Product Management for MAPLE, Design and IDEAS owns the analytic roadmap for multiple global business lines (IDEAS) and an ML-based recommendation software for Payments (MAPLE). In this role, you will lead a 40-person global team of data scientists, applied scientists, data engineers, and product managers based in 5 locales. As a trusted partner and strategic advisor to GMs, you will lead your team to influence decision making for negotiations, product design and more. This is a unique role that requires a sharp mind, business acumen and Earn Trust leadership style.In MAPLE, you own the long-term product vision and tech roadmap which is executed by 25 developers, SDMs, TPM and QA, 5 PMs, and 8 ML scientists and data engineers. In this role, you and your team will work with Checkout and DPX in defining new CX. You will also own high impact decisions on an Automation roadmap with 15+ headcount savings and setting a vision for a new ML infrastructure. Your primary focus is on operational excellence and readiness, as the MAPLE system generates free cash flow for Amazon through credit card approvals and payment product usage.IDEAS, Insights Data Engineering And Science, is our analytics team of data scientists, BIEs, business analysts and data engineers. You will have a 20-person IDEAS team in NA, EU and JP. These teams are growing as we continue to launch new businesses for customers. Success in this role requires hiring and developing the best. You and your managers will identify science and engineering talent, develop growth plans and promote the best.Our Design team owns the front ends CX for all Payment Products worldwide. This team is composed of 16 designers based in the US and EU today. You will support the Design leader in transforming our culture and product roadmap to be customer driven. Ensure that we meet Amazon’s high bar for customer experience, while moving the customer experience to be seamless and frictionless.Key requirements for this role include:Experienced in defining a product vision and long-term strategy for a technical productEarn trust with peers, both tech and non-tech, and communicate openly5+ years product management expertise, ability and interest to dive deep on a tech roadmapYour learn and be curious is off the chartsPreferred QualificationsMBA, MS or advanced degree in mathematics, statistics, science or engineering10+ years professional experience operating as a manager of managersUnderstanding of financial industry products and P&Ls

title: Senior Manager (Threat Detection & Hunting)
description: FICO (NYSE: FICO) is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 90+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!Job SummaryJob DescriptionOpportunityCome join our FICO Cyber Security team in a hands-on technical role where you will get a chance to work with cutting-edge technologies in securing FICO networks, applications, and its customers. In the past recent years, FICO Cyber Security team has seen an unprecedented growth and commitment to reshape/mature the Cyber Security program at FICO. We look forward to working with the top talent in taking our Cyber Security program to the next level. Join us in this exciting adventure and make an impact. - Cyber Security DirectorWhat You’ll ContributeThe Senior Manager, Detection & Hunting is a key role in Cyber Security Center team at FICO. It is a hands-on senior level role that is a subject matter expert in creating SIEM use cases/detections and perform hunting across the FICO network and its applications. It also mentor junior engineers and analysts across multiple domains such as incident response, hunting, and automation. It will proactively conduct threat hunting on FICO network and also assist in tier 2/3 incident investigations.What We’re SeekingProactively conduct threat hunting across FICO network.Create and oversee use cases and detections for SIEM and other security tools.Assist in investigating and responding to intrusion events/incidents using SIEM, packet captures, file analysis, endpoint logs etc.Assist in automation of repetitive investigative procedures.Manage detection & hunting program and act as mentor for other teams in Cyber Security Center.Basic Qualifications:10+ years of experience in a similar role such as incident response, security operations center, hunting, reverse engineering, SIEM engineer and automation.2+ year of management or leadership experience.Strong experience with industry leading SIEM tools such as Splunk, ArcSight and Qradar.Understanding of security operations center workflow and responsibilities.Understanding of incident response processes and procedures.Desired Skills:Industry security certifications such as ISC2, GIAC, or EC-CouncilExperience with hunting in cloud securityEducation :Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.Our Offer to YouA culture and work environment strongly reflecting our core values: Act like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.The opportunity to make a difference by leveraging your unique strengths.Highly competitive compensation and rewards.Flexible work options, opportunities to give back to your community, social events with colleagues and a comprehensive benefits program inclusive of progressive parental leave.Why Make a Move to FICO?At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive modeling, and much more.FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:Credit Scoring — 150+ billion FICO Scores have been sold to date, making it the most used credit score in the world.Fraud Detection and Security — 2.6+ billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.Anti-Money Laundering — our solutions check more than half a billion transactions a day to prevent criminal schemes such as terrorist financingGlobal trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We support many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success.Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!Learn more about how you can fulfill your potential at www.fico.com/CareersFICO values the benefit that diversity and a culture of inclusion bring to our workplace. We are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

title: Project Manager - Refrigeration
description: CSI is looking for a Refrigeration Project Engineer for our Grand Prairie, Texas location. The individual in this role will need to be detail oriented and able to solve problems with an “outside the box” approach while learning in a fast paced environment. Responsibilities will include meeting with customers, designing and bidding of potential projects, project management, and assistance and support of site installation crews. Technical support for industrial refrigeration system installation, troubleshooting, equipment repair, and instrumentation selection will be required. The Refrigeration Project Engineer must be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, both in and out-of-house. Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills are required to build successful relationships with co-workers, vendors, and external customers. Up to 25% of travel may be required with this position.About Our CompanyCSI offers 40 years of experience providing state-of-the-art stainless steel process equipment and service for the food, dairy, beverage, pharmaceutical, and personal care industries. Our desire is, and always has been, to create an environment where employees feel valued and choose to make life-long careers. We offer an excellent benefits and compensation package.Required SkillsComputer proficiency with word processing, spreadsheet and/or databaseRequired ExperienceEducation/TrainingBachelor’s degree in Engineering; mechanical, chemical or building construction, preferredValid driver’s licenseExperienceProject managementKnowledge of refrigeration design for glycol and chilling water systemsKnowledge and experience with industrial refrigeration piping systems and equipment associated with ammonia refrigeration systems for food and distribution centers and food processing facilities5 years in managing or designing industrial ammonia refrigeration systems5 years of on-site construction managementPiping design, pipe fitting or weldingIndustrial refrigeration system installation, troubleshooting, equipment, and instrumentation selectionThis position requires the ability to interact with employees verbally and in writing, remain in a stationary position for 80% of the workday, have close visual acuity, and constantly operate a computer and other office productivity equipment, such as a phone, copy/fax/scan machine, computer keyboard and mouse with or without reasonable accommodation. This position also requires the ability to occasionally lift up to 20 pounds, stoop, and bend.CSI has a long standing policy of Equal Opportunity in employment. Our practice is to fill positions by selecting applicants who can perform the work in a competent and professional manner. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or individuals with disability. U.S. federal law requires completion of employment eligibility verification upon hire. CSI participates in E-Verify. Must have the right to work in the United States.

title: Senior Product Manager - Technical
description: MBA/MS in Business / Math / Stats / Operations / Engineering or equivalent7+ years of relevant experienceProject/product management experience including financial/cost-benefit analysisExperience with understanding and documenting complex process flowsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsSignifcant experience working with Software Development teams to deliver software productsHave you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrives you wonder how it got to you so fast? Wondered where it came from and how much it would have cost Amazon? If so, the Amazon Global Supply Chain Optimization Team is for you. We build systems to peer into the future and estimate the distribution of tens of millions of products every week to Amazon’s warehouses in the most cost-effective way. When customers place orders, our systems use real time, large scale optimization techniques to optimally choose where to ship from and how to consolidate multiple orders so that customers get their shipments on time or faster with the lowest possible transportation costs. This team is focused on saving hundreds of millions of dollars using cutting edge science, machine learning, integer programming and scalable distributed software on the Cloud that automates and optimizes inventory and shipments to customers under the uncertainty of demand, pricing and supply.Amazon seeks a passionate, results-oriented, inventive Senior Product Manager to own a new business opportunity that will involve defining a large scale, high availability software systems using mathematical modeling, simulations and data analysis. This is a highly visible role leading a team to work with dozens of teams across the supply chain. You will be designing new systems to measure the impact of our supply chain operations in terms of long term free cash flow which is the one of the core metrics within Amazon. We are looking for a Product Manager who thrives on complex problems and relishes the challenge of operating complex and mission critical systems under extreme loads. We strive to solve complex supply chain optimization problems that no one else has solved yet. Do you think you are up to the challenge? Would you like to learn more and stretch your skills and career? Successful candidates will be strong leaders who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. A strong candidate should understand various optimization techniques and build innovative software solutions working with the supply chain business partners in delivering a viable solution.Key ResponsibilitiesLead product roadmap and strategy for Sales and Operations Planning productsWork closely with senior management and engineers to deliver innovative software productsCreate buy-in for product vision both internally and externally and evangelize that vision within the organizationDevelop detailed business requirements that can be used to create product specifications and designManage delivery of current products concurrently with future product planningDrive projects, product and feature launches with teams inside AmazonFamiliarity with the design and operation of complex planning systems and processes.Independent and entrepreneurial outlook. Proven ability to work with minimal direction.Advanced presentation skills and the ability to guide and influence senior leadershipHigh attention to detail and proven track record in taking ownership, driving results and moving with speed to implement ideas in a fast paced online environmentExperience in Supply Chain and Inventory Management

title: Principal Program Manager
description: What We Do:We build OneDrive for consumers, schools, and businesses. We create experiences to access your files and collaborate safely and securely across Windows, Mac, web, mobile, and 3rd parties. OneDrive serves hundreds of millions of users and is one of the largest cloud services in the world.We build SharePoint. SharePoint is the world’s most successful content management solution. It is the foundation of the modern intranet and powers content services and collaboration across Office 365, which serves hundreds of millions of users around the globe.Our Culture:We are a diverse team of program managers and data scientists. We offer experiences from building consumer mobile features to developer experiences to large scale distributed systems. We are data informed and hypothesis driven and measure our outcomes to prove we deliver value to customers. We partner closely with a talented and senior set of engineers, designers, and researchers. Most of our team is local to Redmond, Washington. We also work with peers in Europe & Asia. We all contribute directly to OneDrive & SharePoint.Part of building a successful team is having an inclusive workplace where all people and ideas are welcome. To this end, we’ve created local mentoring rings and communities where we can learn from each other and grow. We focus on having inclusive meetings that foster useful dialog. We’ve instituted a #noscreens policy during meetings to help. Transparency is also core to our culture. We leverage internal & external tools to get feedback, celebrate the work of our peers, and drive local and industry level changes. Additionally, we believe strongly in providing new opportunities for talent mobility & experimentation in your job with other parts of the team and company.Lastly, we focus on, and have a track record of, delivering strong business results with key metrics to track our successes and failures. We like to have fun, celebrate our wins, and learn from our mistakes.ResponsibilitiesThe Work:We work with an ever-evolving online landscape; the technology that powers it and the way people and bots use it is constantly changing. Most of that use is for good, be it to increase productivity, stay in touch with loved ones, or improve the world we live in. Some of that use is nefarious, and our job is to ensure we can distinguish this type of usage and end it. Our team is responsible for improving the online safety of our products. We partner with teams across Microsoft, the technology industry, and universities / research arms. The team operates against massively scaled out services that generate billions of requests per second across hundreds of millions of users around the globe. We work with exabytes of content in various container types.We’re looking for a program manager who is passionate about improving the safety and security of our services. You’ll need to understand the evolving legal and regulatory requirements that are landing for cloud services as well as how to stay ahead of them / have Microsoft lead in this space. You’ll work across the entirety of the Experiences and Devices group at Microsoft to land a scalable and standardized vision and platform in this space. You’ll work with machine learning models, distributed caching systems as well as with policy makers and legal experts. You’ll have the opportunity to share your work broadly across Microsoft in addition to working with others in the industry facing similar challenges.Qualifications5+ years of software experience, ideally with cloud platformsA track-record of owning technical and architectural decisions for a software or hardware productThe ability to lead across disciplines, collaborate, and influence your peersThe ability to empathize, listen, and obsess over our customers, external and internalWe recognize that talent comes in many forms. If you think you’ve got what it takes, we want to hear from you!Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.KPMG is currently seeking a Manager in Cyber Secruity for our Consulting practice.Responsibilities:Collate data from multiple digital fraud and security tools for deeper threat insights using advanced analyticsApply a firm understanding of customer identify and access management, Security Monitoring and Incident Response methodology In addition, they will need to have great insight into the progression of industrialized construction, digitized sites, collaboration tools, machine learning, robotics, AR/VR and augmented reality. As part of the Americas Education team this person will execute education programs primarily through face to face direct engagement with University Deans, Professors and other Administrators, as well as support at some high schools, and vocational/apprenticeship programs. title: Manager, Product Management (Enterprise Products and Platforms)
description: Towers Crescent (12066), United States of America, Vienna, VirginiaAt Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Manager, Product Management (Enterprise Products and Platforms)Do you love technology? Are you naturally curious? Do you enjoy solving problems? If you answered yes to any or all of these questions, we want to talk.Enterprise Customer Intelligence is a team of product managers, data scientists and engineers who are passionate about making financial products that better serve our customers. We develop APIs, data platforms, and tools for Capital One to apply customer context to our products and experiences. In a nutshell? We love analyzing data and harnessing it to make our customer’s lives easier.We are looking for a highly technical product manager with a passion for real time data products who can deliver innovative and new tools and platform services that enable product managers, developers, marketers, data scientists, and analysts to utilize Machine Learning and customer context when solving business problems.The Role:In this role, you will work with engineering teams to build and enhance a real time data pipeline which provides teams throughout Capital One the customer-centric behavioral data needed to power real-time, intelligent experience across all our customer facing products. You’ll relay technical data details, results, and actionable insights to people (above and below you) with less technical prowess in an understandable way to foster support for your roadmap and to influence partner team’s product roadmaps. You’ll use both your product skills and deep understanding of technology to drive meaningful changes across the company that materially enhance Capital One’s data ecosystem.Ideal candidate has:Hands on experience managing a technical platform and working with a range of cloud based streaming technologies (ie: Kafka, Kinesis, Spark, Flink)A deep-seeded passion for data, and love for getting in the weeds of behavioral analytics.A proven track record of bringing new enterprise technical products or features to market while balancing multiple projects and responsibilities.The ability to balance consumer outcomes and business needs with technical feasibility and delivery.Experience with or an understanding of machine-learning and architecture of adaptive systems.Curiosity and attention to detail which drives you to question assumptions, validate your own work, and master complex systems.Cultivated and championed a data-driven and customer-focused product mindset.Accountabilities:Drive a product vision and strategy for the next iteration of our data pipeline which exceeds industry standards and obtain buy in by articulating a clear and compelling product roadmap with clearly defined success metrics.Prioritize and rationalize roadmap against business needs, longer term platform health and partnership needs.Oversee and coordinate the delivery and launch of tools that enable partner product teams to build their own data-driven products.Manage inter-team and technology dependencies to mitigate project and product risks.Establish SLAs and key performance metrics based on customer use cases; partner with technology teams to ensure performance targets are maintained as the platform scales to support new use cases and business demand increases.Develop and nurture collaborative working relationships with key internal partners including business teams, various product teams, and enterprise technology organizations.Basic Qualifications:Bachelor’s DegreeAt least 5 years of experience in technical product managementAt least 3 years of experience with data analysis or software engineeringPreferred Qualifications:Masters or Minor in Computer Science5+ years experience working with data products, platforms, and streaming data5+ years experience with data repositories and query paradigms (relational, schema-on-read, graph, time series)5+ years experience with hands-on technical product management in an Agile environment2+ years of experience working with JIRA and ConfluenceAt this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

title: Quality Control Manager (Heavy Civil Group)
description: Quality Control Manager (Heavy Civil Group)(Job Number: 190001RN)Building a career at Granite may be the most valuable thing you could do...Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to build your career and personal brand? If so, then you’ve come to the right place!General SummaryGranite’s project team needs an experienced Heavy Civil Construction Engineer to work in the Dallas Fort Worth region as a Quality Control Manager.Granite’s Construction Engineers work on heavy civil projects with Superintendents, field surveyors, subcontractors and other construction engineers to develop and implement submittals, work plans and schedules for heavy concrete formwork, falsework, mass concrete placement, structural steel erection, earthwork operations, and commissioning of the project. All construction engineers participate in safety, quality, environment and production planning and control both in the office and in the field.At Granite the Quality Control Manager will manage the quality inspection and testing staff comprised of Granite personnel and subcontracted personnel; Participate in work planning and scheduling to meet Contract requirements; Review work plans and submittals for Contract compliance; Manage submittal process to the Owner; Be responsible for the daily submittal of the quality tests, inspections and daily activity reports using the Owner’s computer system; and Lead the three phase Quality Control System which include holding preparatory meetings, initial inspection meetings and managing follow up inspections and documentation.Essential Job AccountabilitiesManage Quality Control staff, subcontractors and consultants to ensure compliance with contract requirements, budget, schedule, forecasting and job costing.Supervise, direct, and mentor project staff to ensure individual development and that project standards are met, and work is completed on time and under budget.Schedule and coordinate quality staff with construction activities to ensure work is completed on time and under budget.Provide technical support in construction planning, quality control, interpretation of design, application of construction methods, resolution and documentation of design conflicts, and constructability reviews to ensure successful job completion.Develop, implement and administer Quality Control procedures and other work controlling documents to ensure clarification of roles.Represent company, project and/or department during client and project management meetings to ensure effective communication.Develop and maintain all job reporting and logs to ensure project compliance.Work Experience5+ years of heavy civil construction engineering, field support, QC Management, inspection and testing, or similar experience.Prefer candidates having experience with density control embankment, pavement, municipal waterlines, excavation, earthen dam, concrete, formwork, hydroelectric, USACE, airport or Department of Transportation projects.Prefer candidates with knowledge of construction inspection and materials inspection, particularly density controlled field tests for soils compaction.EducationBachelor’s Degree in Civil, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering or Construction Management requiredKnowledge, skills, and abilitiesEIT and progress toward PE, preferredUSACE Construction Quality Management (CQM) Certification preferredProficiency with all MS Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.), andAdvanced knowledge of construction engineering technology, materials testing codes, standards, etc. plus an in-depth understanding of the interdependence and relationship between other functional units required.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, plus demonstrated ability to manage a team of varied disciplines.Additional Requirements/SkillsComply, understand, and support corporate safety initiatives to ensure a safe work environment.Team playerAbility and willingness to abide by Granite’s Code of Conduct on a daily basisValid driver’s license and ability to drivePhysical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit and use hands to operate a computer keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Subject to outside working conditions. At times will be working around large construction equipment, must be safety conscience.About Granite Construction IncorporatedGranite Construction Incorporated is a member of the S&P 400 Index and is the parent company of Granite Construction Company, one of the nation's largest heavy civil contractors and construction materials producers. Granite Construction is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities and a Drug-Free Workplace. For additional information on applicant/employee rights please click here.Since 1922, Granite Construction has continued its long standing commitment to building some of America’s largest infrastructure projects including highways, bridges, dams, rail, and power. Recognized as one of the top 25 largest construction companies in the U.S., Granite specializes in complex infrastructure projects and provides award-winning construction services in mining, earthwork, water/sewer, power, tunneling, rail, highway and bridge construction. Granite also produces construction materials-sand, gravel, ready-mix, recycled asphalt product and asphalt concrete, and is a proven leader in alternative procurement project delivery.At Granite, our employees are our most valued asset and we are passionate about retaining, developing, and recruiting the best talent available. Our employees reflect our core values: Honesty, Integrity, Fairness, Accountability, Consideration of Others, Pursuit of Excellence, Reliability Safety and Citizenship and we are continuously looking for individuals who possess a winning attitude and share our Core Values. In exchange, we help you build a career that no other company can duplicate. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued. Add our award winning safety program, ethics, reputation, and a commitment to continuous improvement and you’ll see that we are building more than infrastructure—together, we are building your future.Notice to Staffing AgenciesGranite Construction, Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Granite") will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to Granite, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Granite mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Granite employees, or to Granite's resume database will be considered Granite property. Granite will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Granite will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. Agencies must obtain advance written approval from Granite's recruiting function to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract for service and in response to a specific job opening. Granite will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement in place. Agency agreements will only be valid if in writing and signed by Granite's Human Resources Representative or his/ her designee. No other Granite employee is authorized to bind Granite to any agreement regarding the placement of candidates by Agencies.Area of Interest Quality ManagementPrimary Location US-TX-LewisvilleSchedule Full-time

We use data, beautiful software, and innovative design to put customers first at every step in the home-buying and selling process. Get ready to dive headfirst into our award-winning website and mobile apps, solving complex business problems in a highly visible, customer-centric way. title: Engineering Program Manager
description: Who Are We?QinetiQ Inc. is an innovative C5ISR Systems and Technology leader. Our company is built on a foundation of advanced technology, systems engineering, rapid prototyping, and improved operational sensing. We work with the latest technological developments in government, industry, and academia, leveraging that knowledge to rapidly advance the state of the art, combining cutting edge sensor technology with innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).We are a world-class team of professionals that build Ground Systems, Solider Systems, Airborne Sensing and Processing Technologies and Integrated C2 solutions. Our customers are always our number one priority and our mission is to empower and protect American Warfighters and Security Forces!Your Contribution to Our Mission:QinetiQ, Inc. is seeking a well-qualified EPM candidate with extensive knowledge and strong communication skills to join our team of diverse multidisciplinary engineers at our Lorton, VA Office. The EPM will lead the execution of highly complex technical projects by leveraging strong project management experience, technical and people leadership skills, sensitivity to program budget and schedule constraints, communication and negotiation skills and strong collaborative working relationships. This role requires the ability to manage projects from initial scoping to prototype delivery to product launch in a way that ensures success. The successful candidate will have the experience and knowledge to support the full system life-cycle design through development, integration, test, delivery and production readiness of leading-edge Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) sensor systems solutions for ground and airborne platforms. A successful candidate will have a diverse set of project management and systems engineering skills with experience defining, architecting, designing, and developing systems for deployed environments. The EPM will act as a technical multidisciplinary lead on hardware and software-based system, on IRAD, CRAD and seedling projects, and on engineering upgrade programs to field deployable systems. They will guide technical teams throughout the system life cycle and document system architecture, prepare and execute critical program milestones (i.e. SRR, PDR, CDR, TRR), and oversee system fabrication, integration, testing and deployment. The EPM will directly interface with the PMs, oversee vendors and suppliers, participate in technical and program management reviews and verify program execution within budget and schedule constraints. The EPM will recommend future direction on projects to management and deliver technical and program briefs to government and contractor personnel at all levels.To Land This Job, You Need:Minimum 10 years demonstrated experience as a Photonics or Electro-Optics Engineer in design, integration, and test of C5ISR systems, such as EO-IR, hyperspectral, Lasers and optical sensors and systems for ground and airborne applications.Minimum 5 years experience leading multidisciplinary team of engineering in executing ISR and EO-IR based sensor systems projects.Minimum 5 years experience developing project scope, objectives and timelines involving all relevant stakeholders and managing technical execution of several projects simultaneously.Strong technical aptitude and ability to quickly process information and adjust plans and schedules.Strong ability to collaborate and share information to ensure essential personnel are kept apprised of project changes.Ability to interpret technical discussions and summaries from program managers, end users and engineers.Identify and manage issues as they arise with each project, manage risk against project priorities, and escalate issues to upper management as needed.Create and maintain project documentation, project plans, budgets, and revenue forecasts.Interfaces with all aspects of the team to resolve system engineering issues and actions.Performs life-cycle systems engineering for sensor systems.Provides system engineering support and advice for system integration on new platforms when required. Evaluates project initiatives, designs, and design changes at the system level for cost/schedule/performance impacts.Experience with working directly with end users to translate CONOPS to solidified requirements, and to provide feedback on implemented system functionality.Demonstrate a working knowledge of defining and selecting appropriate EO-IR sensors, image and signal processors, and software/firmware tools compatible with system requirements and budget/schedule constraints.Provide expertise and direction in architecting new capabilities with a demonstrated ability to independently determine and develop a solution approach.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, proposal writing skills, and ability to convey technical designs, ideas and results to non-technical audiences and provide briefings to high-level government personnel.Strong people skills and ability to interact with highly technical non-technical audience, customers, end users, vendors and support staff.BS degree in Physics, Electro-Optics, Electrical, Mechanical, or other related Engineering disciplineMS degree preferredExperience with Electro-Optical, ISR and electronic systems.Experience with proposal writing, BOEs generations and project managementExperience in architecting, defining, designing, developing, integrating and testing ISR and EO‑IR sensor systems for defense applications.Clearance Level Must Currently Possess:Eligible to obtain security clearanceWhy QinetiQ Inc.?Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces.Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement.We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry.We have fun! We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments.We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options.No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.

title: Technical Program Manager
description: At Facebook Reality Labs (FRL), we're developing the future of augmented and virtual reality. As a Technical Program Manager, your job will be figuring out what we need to do to build it and deliver it. You'll be a critical member of a multi-disciplinary team contributing to our efforts to gain a scientific understanding of audio and the ways audio can be integrated with haptics, human and machine perception, input, optics, and display technology - ultimately translating audio technologies into compelling AR and VR experiences for our users.You will work closely with internal Reality Labs and Facebook teams and leverage your expert program management experience to bring order to chaos by listening carefully to the team’s needs and optimizing program management tools that enable them to create amazing audio technologies. You will provide scope definition strategies, communication strategies, team roles and responsibilities definitions, milestone definition and tracking tools, decision making tools, and risk mitigation plans. You will facilitate highly technical discussions ensuring clarity and focus while teasing out next steps to keep a forward momentum towards solving key problems for end users. functional.TECHNICAL PROGRAM MANAGER RESPONSIBILITIESWork with research, applied research, and engineering teams to define and deliver high quality prototypes demonstrating key experiences for future services.Experience working with a cross-disciplinary team of researchers, software engineers and hardware engineers.Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the title: Customer Success Manager
description: ClosedLoop was recognized as one of BuiltInAustin's top startups to watch in 2019 and was recently awarded as a 50 on Fire winner from AustinInno!ClosedLoop is Healthcare’s Data Science Platform and we’re changing the way healthcare organizations use data science tools to improve their patient’s health. You will successfully guide customers from implementation through mastery to expansion and advocacy in support of our customer first strategy. You will be the main point of contact for new customer onboarding and implementations, and driving customer projects to completion. You are a polished communicator, technically astute, with outstanding project management and organizational skills who can work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the customers’ timely realization of value. You’re an advocate for the company, and the voice of the customer. You will work with internal stakeholders to identify opportunities to improve the product.Who You Are:You are connected to the customer on every level, and you have a proven track record with getting customers to production and reducing churnYou are an experienced project manager who knows how to keep internal teams on track to deliver value along the wayExceptional client management and communication skillsYou love to create customer-facing training materials, and create a better process for onboarding customers and assuring they can be successful post-implementationYou are a champion and advocate of our customers. You feel that people deserve to have great experiences with our products. The passion for our company's mission is contagious from the executive team, which makes our high standards fair and rewarding.""Room to thrive""Passionate People, Supportive Environment, & Strong Vision"Job Type: Full-timeWork authorization:United States (Required)Work Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insurancePaid time offFlexible scheduleSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:www.closedloop.aiWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

title: Data Science Program Manager
description: STR is a government research contractor specializing in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and homeland security applications. We pride ourselves in developing cutting-edge technologies with significant and immediate impact on our national security. Our product is our staff; we prioritize cultivating a team of driven and talented scientists, engineers and program managers that together culminate into a premier company.Every Analyst a Scientist - One of our primary goals is to empower intelligence analysts to be able to study their data like scientists. The tools we develop focus on streamlining intelligence analysis through integrated algorithms and software that provide insight into the geopolitical landscape for use in operational intelligence missions around the world.The Role:We are currently seeking a program manager who is passionate about problem solving through teamwork. The successful candidate will help manage research & development programs in the area of data science and machine learning. As Program Manager, you will work with leadership and technical teams to coordinate cost estimating and reporting; engage with key stakeholders; and develop/maintain business management procedures for all task areas. You should be able to bridge technical understanding and operational requirements of our government customers. Your responsibilities include receiving requirements from our program customer(s), tracking the program schedule and milestones, coordinating with the STR Contracts and Finance teams, providing quality assurance on reports, and tracking program risk. You will support timely, successful deliveries of products to the customer. You will routinely collaborate across multi-disciplined teams in order to support the Principal Investigator and other key stakeholders. You will also support coordination with STR sub-contractors, ensuring smooth integration and accomplishment of assigned tasks. You will principally work onsite at our government customer location(s), with occasional travel to other stakeholder sites to engage with end users.If you would like to help intelligence and defense analysis keep pace with technology-driven innovation, then this role is for you!Who you are:Master's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Business, or other related scientific or technical discipline with two or more years related professional experienceExperienced in managing technical projects, developing tasks/sub-tasks, identifying & tracking program risk; building WBS, Gantt charts, and tracking POA&MMotivated collaborator and excellent communicator of ideas to both technical and non-technical audiencesActive U.S. SCI ClearanceEven better:Prior experience in a leadership role of a technical program for the Department of Defense or intelligence communityStrong interpersonal communication skills, with the means to bridge technical and operational areasExperience with software development best practices and toolsUnderstanding of large and complex data setsFamiliarity with machine learning or statistical modeling techniquesCompensation:Competitive salaryComprehensive benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Life)401k company matchCompetitive and flexible paid time offContinued higher education reimbursementProfit sharing (Additional match to 401k)Phone reimbursement planAnd more!Work Location: Arlington, VAJob Type (Full Time/Part Time): Full TimeSTR is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce where all employees, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, neurodiversity, or other personal characteristics, feel valued, included, and empowered to achieve their best. We recognize that each employee’s backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are essential for providing our customers with innovative solutions to challenging national security problems. STR’s commitment to attracting, retaining, and engaging talented and diverse professionals is demonstrated by our participation, sponsorship, and support in local and national minority organizations.

title: Manager, Performance Architecture
description: What you do at AMD changes everythingAt AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.Manager, Performance ArchitectureThe role:AMD’s Memory Subsystem Performance Architecture team delivers performance features and models for all of AMD’s flagship processors. This includes the CPUs, GPUs, and APUs that power AMD’s Server, Client, Game Console, discrete graphics, and machine learning products. As the Manager of this high-caliber team, the individual will be responsible to lead experienced performance architects and modeling engineers who are engaged in analyzing and optimizing high-performance memory subsystem designs for Cloud computing, machine intelligence acceleration, and immersive mobile processing.The person:The successful candidate will be motivated to lead teams that seek the most complex and exciting challenges in the computing industry. You will have a proven track record leading teams to deliver exceptional results and have a reputation as a technical influencer.Key responsibilities:Serving as the Performance Architecture Manager, you will guide the team’s deliverables and coordinate the dependencies with leads from multiple business units and collaborate with the executive team on program execution reviews. This also entails participating n next generation product planning, concept/HLD reviews and lead the team to carry out microarchitecture exploration, performance modeling, and analysis for next-generation memory technologies, scalable interconnects, and quality-of-service.Additional responsibilities include:Intimately understand design architecture and propose solutions to enhance performanceLeading micro-benchmarking, workload characterization, competitive analysis, bottleneck identification, and optimization.Set direction to the team that develops tools and methodology for performance analysis of workloads.Communicate, propose, and implement solutions to processor and system performance issues.Preferred experience:We are seeking a person with a demonstrated background in Performance Architecture who is also a technical leader.Experience with CPU, GPU, or computer system microarchitectureExperience with the development and usage of computer system performance modelsExperience with computer workload analysisExperience with leading staffing, budget planning, project execution and cross-team dependenciesAcademic credentials:MS in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a closely related field#LI-MG1Requisition Number: 79120Country: United States State: Texas City: AustinJob Function: DesignAMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. We consider candidates regardless of age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status.
