title: Program Manager
description: Who Are We?QinetiQ Inc. is an innovative C5ISR Systems and Technology leader. Our company is built on a foundation of advanced technology, systems engineering, rapid prototyping, and improved operational sensing. We work with the latest technological developments in government, industry, and academia, leveraging that knowledge to rapidly advance the state of the art, combining cutting edge sensor technology with innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).We are a world-class team of professionals that build Ground Systems, Solider Systems, Airborne Sensing and Processing Technologies and Integrated C2 solutions. Our customers are always our number one priority and our mission is to empower and protect American Warfighters and Security Forces!Your Contribution to Our Mission:Serve as the Program Manager for one or more system and technology development projects; QinetiQ develops electro-optical and infrared (EO/IR) and other (e.g. radar, acoustic) sensor systems, as well as electronics modules and systems that interface to sensors and users of sensor/data products.Oversee all aspects of the assigned program and its related projects to ensure compliance with technical requirements, schedule, and budget.Work closely with the QinetiQ Senior Ground Combat Systems Division (GCSD) Director supporting daily activities as required between the home office and customer site.Lead interdisciplinary teams of engineers and other technical staff, and interface with the customer and other third parties via Integrated Product Teams (IPTs).Develop Integrated Master Schedules (IMS) and execute plans to ensure a mitrixed workforce successrully fulfils project requirements.Prepare reports for upper management regarding project status and execute to plans to ensure a matrixed workforce successfully fulfills project requirements.Ensure that all weekly and monthly CDRLs are prepared and delivered on-time.Develop technical and cost proposals in response to RFPs.Support company sales, profit, and growth objectives.To Land This Job, You Need:MUST BE A US CITIZEN, With an ACTIVE Secret, or higher security clearance - no waiver.Bachelor’s degree and at least five years of related experience managing DoD or Federal projects/programs.Fully proficient with communication management tools in MS Project and other MS Office applications.Detailed understanding of the DoD environment, preferably with former military experience of multiple years in a Ground Combat Arms Branch at mid to senior grade leadership levels.Must understand the Warfighter ground and platform sensor requirements from technology, concept of operation, system design, soldier utilization, and Warrior/Machine Interface needs.Hands-on experience in technical system operation of military sensors, night vision devices, thermal sensors/sights, or spectral sensing devices.Experienced in all phases of proposal development for competitive opportunities.Experience developing Bases of Estimates (BOE's) and estimating levels of effort and cost for developmental services and products.Must be able to work cocurrent projects, with multiple requirements, on separate schedules.Manage the execution, completion and submission of all work products and deliverables.This role is customer facing. The PM must maintain a strong client focus, be responsive to client requests, and develop/maintain productive working relationships with client personnel.Demonstrated experience in integrated risk management, supplier management, and full project life-cycle management.Excellent written and oral communication skillsProfessional experience using MS Office to include Project, PowerPoint, Word, and Excel.Must be able to readily adapt to changing priorities.Strong self-starter requiring minimal supervision.Clearance Level Must Currently Possess:DOD Secret or higherWhy QinetiQ Inc.?Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces.Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement.We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry.We have fun! We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments.We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options.No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.Accessibility/Accommodation:If because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to staffing@us.qinetiq.com or call (540) 658-2720 Opt 4 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.QinetiQ Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

title: PROJECT MANAGER I
description: PROJECT MANAGER I(Job Number: 2000015D)Building a career at Granite may be the most valuable thing you could do...Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to build your career and personal brand? If so, then you’ve come to the right place!Since 1922, Granite Construction has continued its long standing commitment to building some of America’s largest infrastructure projects including highways, bridges, dams, rail, and power. Recognized as one of the top 25 largest construction companies in the U.S., Granite specializes in complex infrastructure projects and provides award-winning construction services in mining, earthwork, water/sewer, power, tunneling, rail, highway and bridge construction. Granite also produces construction materials-sand, gravel, ready-mix, recycled asphalt product and asphalt concrete, and is a proven leader in alternative procurement project delivery.At Granite, our employees are our most valued asset and we are passionate about retaining, developing, and recruiting the best talent available. Our employees reflect our core values: Honesty, Integrity, Fairness, Accountability, Consideration of Others, Pursuit of Excellence, Reliability Safety and Citizenship and we are continuously looking for individuals who possess a winning attitude and share our Core Values. In exchange, we help you build a career that no other company can duplicate. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued. Add our award winning safety program, ethics, reputation, and a commitment to continuous improvement and you’ll see that we are building more than infrastructure—together, we are building your future.General SummaryThe NW Washington area of Granite is growing and looking to add a motivated construction engineer that's ready to take the next step into project management or a seasoned professional looking for a change. This position is responsible for the overall direction, completion, and financial outcome of construction projects up to $15 million in size. Dynamic communication and teamwork are essential for success at Granite.Essential Job Accountabilities1. Perform accurate project revenue and cost financial forecasting to ensure corporate profitability goals are met.2. Coordinate with estimators and project controls group to establish budget.3. Lead estimating efforts on vertically integrated projects to ensure accurate and consistent bid to build process.4. Coordinate efforts with estimators, large project sponsor, and manager of construction to manage resources to meet project schedule.5. Participate in bid review and bid closing to ensure accuracy of bid and evaluate project feasibility; work with estimating team to develop bid schedule.6. Coordinate with large project sponsor, manager of construction and project team to develop comprehensive plan for project start up and successful kick-off.7. Provide environment where dynamic project communication occurs between Project Engineers, Foremen, Superintendents and Construction Manager to ensure work is accomplished in an efficient, profitable, and safe manner.8. Ensure proper job controls, i.e. quantities, costs, revenue and schedule.9. Establish and maintain working relationships with owners, agencies, subcontractors, corporate management, inspectors, etc., providing customer service to develop long-term partnerships with client base.10. Ensure accurate construction reports for the job allowing for continuous improvement in performance.11. Run projects at profitability levels to meet or exceed expected margins.12. Comply, understand, and support corporate safety initiatives to ensure a safe work environment.EducationBS degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Business Administration, or related field or equivalent work experience in heavy civil construction.Work ExperienceThree (3) to five (5) years progressive project experience in heavy civil environments.Minimum of five (5) years experience in paving, dirt, and grading in either private or public environments.Knowledge, skills, and abilitiesKnowledge of construction paving, underground, concrete and grading practices.Knowledge and understanding of union agreements and prevailing wage issues.Maintain ability to work in high production environment.Demonstrated decision-making skills.Excellent leadership skills.Excellent supervisory communication and organizational skills.Accuracy at all times.Physical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit and use hands to operate a computer keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Subject to outside working conditions. At times will be working around large construction equipment, must be safety conscience.Additional Requirements/SkillsAbility to abide by Granite’s Code of Conduct on a daily basis.A team player.About Granite Construction IncorporatedGranite Construction Incorporated is a member of the S&P 400 Index and is the parent company of Granite Construction Company, one of the nation's largest heavy civil contractors and construction materials producers. Granite Construction is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities and a Drug-Free Workplace. For additional information on applicant/employee rights please click here.Notice to Staffing AgenciesGranite Construction, Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Granite") will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to Granite, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Granite mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Granite employees, or to Granite's resume database will be considered Granite property. Granite will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Granite will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. Agencies must obtain advance written approval from Granite's recruiting function to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract for service and in response to a specific job opening. Granite will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement in place. Agency agreements will only be valid if in writing and signed by Granite's Human Resources Representative or his/ her designee. No other Granite employee is authorized to bind Granite to any agreement regarding the placement of candidates by Agencies.Area of Interest ConstructionPrimary Location US-WA-EverettSchedule Full-time

title: Senior Software Engineering Manager
description: With Azure Sentinel, Microsoft is redefining SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) for the cloud era. It leverages cutting-edge cloud technology, big data, machine learning and AI to empower Security Operations Centers to defend against increasingly sophisticated and rapidly evolving cyberthreats.Azure Sentinel was selected as one of the hottest cybersecurity tools capturing the market’s attention for allowing businesses to better assess, prioritize, detect, and respond to threats by automating repeatable processes and ensuring security teams are dealing with the most important alerts.Our team is growing and we’re looking for an Engineering Manager to join us in our journey and help build and grow the team. This position is a unique opportunity to be part of a world class team, building one of the most exciting products in the cybersecurity space from the ground up.We are looking for a passionate, high energy engineering leader to help achieve our mission. You will be responsible for growing a team and helping define and build a new product area in Azure Sentinel. We are looking for someone who is technically excellent and a great people manager, who can work in a highly collaborative environment, partner with the product team , create a clear plan and mission for the team, and someone who is passionate about growing engineers’ careers - helping them achieve their goals while driving high results.ResponsibilitiesAs an Engineering Manager of the ecosystem and community team, you will build and manage a team of full stack engineers, mentor, coach and model our leadership principles and core values.You will be responsible for the delivery and quality of E2E scenarios in a wide product area within Azure Sentinel and take part in the overall vision and strategy of this area. You will own the product backlog, drive execution, service quality and manage outcomes and take an active part in the definition, architecture and release of your team’s scenarios. This team will deal with integrations with different services and technology stacks and will create a platform to enable partners and developers to integrate with Azure Sentinel.You will work closely with product management throughout the product development lifecycle. Partner with local and remote teams, architects, security experts, data scientists, designers, and of course, other engineering managers to collaborate and integrate with additional capabilities that exist in Azure Sentinel’s ecosystem.We are looking for a motivated, result-oriented and collaborative people manager who has a high drive for results - someone who is looking to build an agile, data driven and customer obsessed culture and define clear KPIs to measure impact and use data to drive decision making.QualificationsRequired Qualifications:1+ years as a lead (or technical lead) managing and directly supporting production aspects of medium to large scale services.7+ years of product or engineering experience with a solid shipping track recordPreferred Qualifications:Experience developing and operating cloud services at scalePassion in building and designing large-scale systems; prior experience in building large scale online systems is a big plus.Full stack development experienceAbility to collaborate, communicate, and effectively influence technical strategy with a growth mindsetA track record of mentoring, coaching and developing diverse engineers and leading by example, ability to lead in ambiguous situationsGood cross team, cross geolocation collaboration skills.Knowledge of security technologies is highly desirable but not required.Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:Microsoft Cloud Background Check - This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.#AzureSecOpen #AzureSecEPD

title: Engineering Manager/Project Manager
description: The CompanyRightPlace Consulting is a software development and data science consulting firm here in Austin that is focused on building business applications for the transportation industry. After partnering with Mercedes over the last 2.5 years on several successful projects, we were recently awarded another. We will be collaborating with the teams that are developing the Autonomous Vehicles out of California and Germany to research, design and build better software around the vehicles for a variety of support systems. We are building a think tank around this project to research/design new prototypes using statistics, machine learning and programming. This is an opportunity to work with a very talented team of Engineers and Data Scientists. It is a very exciting undertaking, as it will directly affect the way we all drive on our roads in the near future.The JobWe are looking for an Engineering Manager/Project Manager passionate about leading world-class teams working with cutting edge technologies. What makes you great is that you are a servant leader and you serve your teams by removing roadblocks and giving your team autonomy and ownership. You can earn the respect and provide leadership for software development and data science teams delivering challenging technical solutions on a global scale. You are just as happy talking about architecture and algorithms as you are agile development processes and project planning. Using both your hands-on technical chops as well as providing leadership to your teams is what drives you every day.Beyond supporting the Mercedes projects, you will have multiple other teams supporting many great clients building business applications. This role will lead the overall development effort of the teams helping them plan and execute their sprints. You will report to and work with the CTO to enhance our development processes and best practices.Required Qualifications:Bottom Line: If you are a technologist and want to join a world-class team of Engineers, this could be for you. The more experience you have with any of the listed skills below, the better. We are looking for smart, talented, driven individuals so any combination of skills is acceptable.3+ years of Engineering Management experience leading multiple teamsSignificant prior success as a Software Engineer with excellent programming skillsAbility and desire to lead a team solving challenging technical problemsCreating and managing development processesStrong knowledge of data structures, distributed computing, and algorithmsProject Management/Scrum Master experienceAbility to coach developers, helping them improve their skills and grow their careersExperience working with large data bases and data setsFirm understanding of OOP and TDDA technology generalist – we need someone who knows enterprise, web and/or mobile development and is excited to work with other technologiesResults oriented, self-managed individual – proven track record of delivering on your project estimates with minimal oversightResearches new technologies and incorporates them into new systems and productsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbalIf you are interested in joining a world class team of experts in their field that are passionate about building great software, please send us your resume to info@rightplaceconsulting.com.

title: Senior Technical Product Manager (Machine Learning & Analytics)
description: Bachelor degree in Liberal Arts, Finance, Business Administration, Mathematics, Engineering/Science, Human Centered Design or related fields5+ years of experience gathering complex and cross functional business requirements, translating them into user stories, and working with tech teams to build upon those requirements and launch products.3+ years owning or influencing technical architecture for software, web development and/or big data solutions.The vision of Workforce Intelligence is to design the ideal workforce to meet the customer promise anywhere. This organization leads and influences global workforce strategies that enable Amazon to scale more efficiently while also providing a unique voice for the hourly workforce. This is accomplished through a variety of science driven initiatives, KPI analysis and reporting, predictive modeling, and data engineering. Amazon’s mission is to be the most customer centric company in the world and Workforce Staffing (WFS), the organization responsible for hourly associate hiring globally, is on the front lines of that mission and will be your core customer in this role.As part WFS, the Sr. Technical Product Manager will be the global owner designing and building out recommendation/insight delivery for our business line staffing-funnel management experience. WFS supports multiple businesses throughout Amazon's fulfillment ecosystem and this role will work directly with cross-functional leaders to define mechanisms and tools that arm them and our candidates with actionable insights to drive data-driven decision-making based on research and historical trends. You will work with a diverse team of Research and Data Scientists, SDEs, Data Engineers and BIEs to design personalized, best in class analytical products for our internal workforce.This role requires a uniquely gifted athlete who is naturally curious and runs towards big challenges. You will build out a product management framework including stakeholder analysis and research, prioritization and product reviews, intake/backlog grooming, and build/design personalized analytical experiences. This will be a highly visible and global role impacting all of Amazon Fulfillment. If you are passionate and curious about data, obsess over customers, love questioning the status quo, and want to see and feel a tangible impact to your work, this is the role for you.Key Responsibilities Include:Partner with our Research and Business Intelligence teams to design, build and measure new and existing data driven tools for our operations and candidates.Revolutionize the stakeholder experience within our reports. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: Technical Product Manager, Content Management Platform
description: Towers Crescent (12066), United States of America, Vienna, VirginiaAt Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.Technical Product Manager, Content Management PlatformAt Capital One, the Enterprise Marketing Technology group is empowering marketers to reach their audiences in more meaningful and relevant ways than ever, driving exponential business value with personalized, intelligent content experiences. We thrive where the art of content and the science of experimentation intersect, using machine learning and AI to power world-class, coordinated marketing experiences across channels. This team is made up of product leaders, data scientists, engineers, and designers with a passion for delivering Capital One’s message in exceptionally innovative ways, and we hold a high bar for leading-edge martech leaders who do the same.We are seeking a seasoned technical product manager to lead the platform infrastructure and reliability of Capital One's content management platform, with a background in CMS and fresh perspective on developing great platforms that deliver value.ResponsibilitiesThis individual will be expected to develop a comprehensive understanding of how our partner businesses engage (process) and integrate (technical) with content management, and uncover unmet and emerging needs of those businesses.Based on market trends and needs specific to internal customers, partner with other product management and engineering teams to develop a vision for industry-leading, integrated content management and asset management platform and chart the course for incremental delivery in the product roadmap.Lead the management and innovation around capabilities to easily and efficiently integrate with the content management platform.Manage the prioritization, build/buy decisions, and delivery strategy for cross-platform services, such as workflow management.Own the reliability and health of the platform, managing the delivery of capabilities to increase the stability, speed, and overall performance of the platform.Identify and develop the business case for other platform-level opportunities and “blind spots” to improve the overall performance of the content management platform.Contribute to the Enterprise Marketing Technology group's overall strategy and vision, with a particular lens on platform infrastructure and reliability.Successful candidates will excel in the following areas:Strategic planning - very strong ability to develop a vision for the future, eloquently articulate the case for your vision, and chart the course to get thereProduct delivery - experience and success working with agile development and design teams to deliver world-class solutions using iterative and lean product development principlesPlatform management - experience with and expertise in developing enterprise platformsTechnical - Well versed in the technical operations of enterprise platforms, how software systems integrate, and the basics of enterprise architecture - ideally with experience in a technical roleGrit - natural determination that manifests in a deep sense of ownership over the scope with which you are entrustedCommunication skills - the ability to tell your story in an engaging way and feel at ease presenting to executivesDetail orientation - an innate gravitation towards the details that separate “great” from “good” - you’re not afraid to get in the weeds.OutcomesDevelop deep understanding of content management needs across Capital One’s Lines of Business and across channels, and deliver a robust platform that meets those needs.Develop a clear vision for the future of the content management platform, how it fits into the greater marketing technology ecosystem, and an iterative plan to deliver on the vision over time.Build strong relationships with product management and technical partners (in multiple geographies), and work together to sharpen the processes for development and maturation of the content management platform.Build strong relationships of trust with internal customers, serving as an adviser and advocate for the adoption of services provided by the Enterprise Marketing Technology group.Basic Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree or military experienceAt least 2 years of experience in digital product managementPreferred Qualifications:Master’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or marketingAt least 1+ years of experience with enterprise content management systemsAt least 1+ years of experience with data taxonomiesAt least 1+ years of experience managing data used in real-time personalizationAt this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

title: Principal RDT&E Program Manager
description: Applied Research Associates, Inc. is seeking a Principal RDT&E Program Manager to provide on-site support in support of a Department of Defense (DoD) customer. The applicant will work intimately with a multi-disciplinary team supporting research and analysis in microelectronics, artificial intelligence, machine learning, autonomy, energy and power, software engineering, networking, communication, cyber, electronic warfare, aerial/ground/naval platforms, biotechnology, and space systems. The successful candidate:Applies an interdisciplinary, collaborative approach to plan, design, develop and verify a lifecycle balanced system of systems and system solutions.Engages DoD customers to understands the end-to-end mission that customers want to achieve.Evaluates customer and /operational needs to help define and coordinate system performance requirements, integrate technical parameters and assure compatibility of all physical, functional and program interfaces.Leads and coordinates analyses to optimize total system of systems and/or system architecture.Manages technical responsibilities within project cost and schedule constraints.Resolves cross-functional technical issues.Assess and provide recommendations to the DoD client for decision and action.Provides technical coordination between the DoD client, industry engineers and internal engineering groups to articulate technical issues.Prepares and presents technical information internally and externally that addresses specific subjects of interest.Leads multi-disciplined engineering/science/hardware/software groups to ensure customer contractual requirements are met.Advocates the customer’s critical needs to internal stakeholders.Analyzes and develops recommendations to resolve contractual technical issues at system delivery.Establishes, implements, and documents technology integration or migration strategies.Works across a variety of mission domains and environments, including distributed ground systems and space payloads.Ensures sufficient product definition and coordinate closely with execution teams to ensure successful implementation and adherence to functional and performance specifications.Required Qualifications:Bachelor of Science in a physical science, management, finance, or mathematics and 12+ years of relevant experience.Experience architecting, analyzing, developing, and integrating end-to-end systems in areas such as defense systems, space payloads, ground stations or communications for DoD/government customers.Ability to partner with stakeholders and team leaders to identify mission gaps and develop system solutions which provide customer value.Proven and effective written and verbal communications skills, interpersonal skills and customer focus skills.Experience collaborating in a team environment, with customer, teammate and subcontractor relationships.Experience applying technologies and capabilities in ways not previously anticipated to solve our customers’ ultimate objectives.US citizen with a minimum DoD Top Secret clearance and the ability to obtain SCI accessDesired Qualifications:Current DoD TS/SCI security clearanceMasters Degree with 9+ years experienceAcquisition or R&D experience in areas such as microelectronics, artificial intelligence, machine learning, autonomy, energy and power, software engineering, networking, communication, cyber, electronic warfare, aerial/ground/naval platforms, biotechnology, and space systems.Relevant experience creating and implementing system architectures and complex mission solutions including ground and space assets.Experience with real-time high throughput data processing and defense systems.Experience with functional and physical architecture development.Project Management Professional certificationThis position is contingent upon award of a contract expected in Spring 2020 supporting the Department of Defense.COMPANY INFORMATION:Applied Research Associates, Inc. is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. The company, founded in Albuquerque, NM, in 1979, currently employs over 1200 professionals. ARA offices throughout the United States and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense technologies, civil technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. The corporation also provides sophisticated technical products for environmental site characterization, pavement analysis, and robotics.At ARA, employees are our greatest assets. The corporation realizes that employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels. ARA gives its employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take more active roles as owners. The culture is challenging; innovation and experimentation are the norm. Employees are eligible for contributions which not only add to the company’s success, but also their own through the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please visit our website at www.ara.com.Please apply at www.careers.ara.com for the Principal RDT&E Program Manager position.EducationRequiredDoctor of Science or better in Physical Sciences or related fieldBehaviorsRequiredTeam Player: Works well as a member of a groupLeader: Inspires teammates to follow themFunctional Expert: Considered a thought leader on a subjectEnthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interestDetail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done wellDedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrityMotivationsRequiredSelf-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside helpEqual Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with DisabilitiesThe contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. title: Cybersecurity Project Manager - Cyber Division (VA)
description: STR performs advanced research and development using machine learning, program analysis, optimization, artificial intelligence, and formal methods for the cybersecurity and resiliency of cyber-physical systems. Addressing the most urgent national security challenges, STR is developing fundamentally new capabilities in cyber-physical systems modeling, vulnerability analysis, and attack detection and remediation.We are currently seeking project managers who are passionate about collaborative problem solving. Successful candidates will manage a portfolio of cyber research and development programs. STR is committed to creating a collaborative learning environment that supports deep technical understanding and recognizes the contributions and achievements of all team members. We strive for excellence in technical work that addresses the most important problems in national security.We believe that each employee has a unique set of skills, experiences, and perspectives that are essential to providing our customers with innovative solutions. The skills listed below are intended to give you a sense for the position. If you see an overlap with your skills, go ahead and apply! All applicants must be US citizens with a Secret security clearance.The Role:The project manager is responsible for managing all program phases, from ideation, marketing, and proposal development through execution and program close-out. Daily activities include management and oversight of program technical, financial, and schedule performance. The project manager works with the principal investigator, technical staff, subcontractors, and support personnel to identify and address risks and issues. Candidates must be able to manage program performance through review of metrics and program execution milestones, and gather, evaluate, and synthesize data from multiple sources, such as project reports, project staff, and customer feedback, to understand and communicate status and to identify trends in program performance. This position requires frequent interactions with external program customers and STR leadership.Who You Are:A mid-level technical manager with a BS in a scientific, engineering or mathematical discipline, and some experience managing R&D projects, orA senior-level manager, perhaps with a Masters in a scientific, engineering or mathematical discipline, and several years of experience managing R&D projectsExperience in project management within DoD or IC, and/or functional experience directly supporting program objectives such as managing cost, schedule, and technical performanceAble to manage scientists, engineers, and technicians across broad areas of expertiseAble to achieve cost, schedule, and customer objectives on advanced technology programsAble to work in a fast-paced environment to enable successful contract executionAble to build strong customer relationships and establish open lines of communicationMotivated collaborator and effective communicator to both technical and non-technical audiencesActive Secret clearanceSome Other Relevant Skills You May Have:Experience writing technical proposals, or leading proposal effortsExperience spanning all project phases, from ideation to technology research and product developmentWorking knowledge of DOD acquisition policy and processesTechnical breadth and a demonstrated ability to simultaneously manage multiple, technically diverse programs and teams.Experience marketing and winning new projectsSTR seeks to provide an outstanding work environment for its employees with excellent benefits and competitive compensation.Full-time employees enjoy 401(k), profit sharing, health and welfare benefits, subsidies for training and conference attendance to foster continued learning and development, and a casual yet technically challenging work environment.At STR, we are dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive community to create an environment that is innovative, collaborative and empowering. STR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability status, military veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Applicants must be US Citizens

Is agile a mindset and not just a methodology?We have a highly skilled team that builds applications that use exciting new AWS services and open source frameworks from IoT to Machine Learning to chat bots and image recognition. We are developing reusable artifacts based on trends in customer requests.We are looking for top-notch product managers with a strong agile mindset to drive product innovation and work closely with customers to build these artifacts.What’s in it for you? You will be part of an exceptional team of product managers and engineers where collaboration is highly valued, where frequent customer interaction is a must, where innovation is something that happens every day, where taking risks is encouraged and where every day is Day One. You will face unique challenges, learn from some of the brightest minds in the industry and lead the development of exciting applications that target hard customer problems. You will have the opportunity to be part of one of the fastest growing, customer obsessed, and innovative companies in the world.What will you do?Lead workshops with customers to understand their key business challengesUse Amazon’s Working Backwards product development process to define requirementsDevelop user stories, lead sprint planning, and other agile disciplines to help your team iterate and deliver great softwareUse your strong innovative skills to design exciting features that customers will loveHelp your team invent new approaches and then simplify them to solve really hard business and technical challengesLearn from some of the brightest minds in the business, they would love to also learn from youBuild valuable expertise in AWS services used in Machine Learning, IoT, image recognition, chat bots, and Big DataTake advantage of really strong Amazon internal training opportunities including instructor led courses, expert talks from experts, and informal on the job trainingExperience with AWS services.Ability to understand systems and networking issues.Expertise in agile software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including agile estimation and planning, coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment.Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills.Meets or exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role.Meets or exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexityAmazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

title: Principal Security Program Manager
description: If you have ever signed into Xbox, Skype, Outlook, Office 365, Azure or Dynamics, the Identity Security Team stands between you and cybercriminals. Billions of users sign into millions of apps every day on Microsoft’s identity platforms - the Identity Security team collaborates across Microsoft and the industry to prevent unauthorized access, account takeover, and fraud. Our adversaries include nation state actors, criminal gangs, and hackers trying to steal from, extort, or otherwise harm our customers. Our team’s efforts save individuals from harm, safeguard transactions powering the global digital economy, and support Microsoft’s commitment to defend democracy worldwide.Join our mission focused, diverse, collaborative and yes, FUN team of feature designers, data scientists, and incident responders as we protect our users. In this role, you will lead our efforts to set the industry standard on secure operational models spanning our interactions with downstream teams, support processes, incident preparedness, secure communications, separation of duties, audits, and operation variance detections such as tripwires, honeypots, token theft and key detection. #IdentityJobsResponsibilitiesOperation integrity is critical to our ability to prevent unauthorized access and fraud in Microsoft account systems (and all downstream systems). In this role, you will be responsible for collaborating with operations and engineering teams to determine our overall strategy for ensuring the integrity of our operational environment. This includes:(a) Maintenance and advancement of our existing operational systems, including tripwires, golden token detections, API audits, and more.(b) Establishment of “crisis mode” practices including secure communications, comms preparedness, disaster and breach simulations and other processes to ensure the team can respond efficiently to major events.(c) Working with a dedicated team of engineers to invent and implement new mechanisms to facilitate and automate our secure operations.If you thrive in a culture that is highly customer oriented, then this is a great place for you! You will be working in a close team-oriented environment on rapid iterations to deliver solutions for multiple products/services and at incredible scale. You will have the opportunity to develop shared goals that support win/win results for both our customers and a diverse set product groups across the company.We are experiencing unprecedented business growth so if you are motivated by the challenge of using your skills & knowledge to help protect over a billion people worldwide, come join us!QualificationsRequired Qualifications: These are REQUIRED qualifications. Candidates will be dispositioned out if they do not have these qualifications. These MUST be quantifiable.A bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical field -or- equivalent on-the-job experience8+ years' experience in the security domain or cloud servicesPreferred Qualifications:Previous experience in any of the following: identity systems, threat intelligence, fraud, abuseExperience operating cloud services at significant scale (>10M MAU)Outstanding math and statistics skills with demonstrated applied machine learning and/or analytics experienceAn ability to drive good decisions through data with great attention to detail and excellent logical problem-solving skillsStrong communication skills with a proven bias towards collaboration and teamworkAbility to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Roadway Project Manager (Heavy Civil Construction)
description: Roadway Project Manager (Heavy Civil Construction)(Job Number: 20000110)Building a career at Granite may be the most valuable thing you could do...Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to build your career and personal brand? If so, then you’ve come to the right place!General SummaryThis position is responsible for the overall direction, completion, and financial outcome of approximately $50M worth of roadway work on our $415M High Rise Bridge and I-64 Widening Project. Located in the City of Chesapeake (VA), this project includes approximately 8.75 miles of interstate widening and construction of a new 1.25 mile long crossing over the Elizabeth River with 100’ vertical clearance.Essential Job Accountabilities1. Perform accurate project revenue and cost financial forecasting to ensure corporate profitability goals are met.2. Coordinate with estimators and project controls group to establish budget.3. Lead estimating efforts on vertically integrated projects to ensure accurate and consistent bid to build process.4. Coordinate efforts with estimators, large project sponsor, and manager of construction to manage resources to meet project schedule.5. Participate in bid review and bid closing to ensure accuracy of bid and evaluate project feasibility; work with estimating team to develop bid schedule.6. Coordinate with large project sponsor, manager of construction and project team to develop comprehensive plan for project start up and successful kick-off.7. Provide environment where dynamic project communication occurs between Project Engineers, Foremen, Superintendents and Construction Manager to ensure work is accomplished in an efficient, profitable, and safe manner.8. Ensure proper job controls, i.e. quantities, costs, revenue and schedule.9. Establish and maintain working relationships with owners, agencies, subcontractors, corporate management, inspectors, etc., providing customer service to develop long-term partnerships with client base.10. Ensure accurate construction reports for the job allowing for continuous improvement in performance.11. Run projects at profitability levels to meet or exceed expected margins.12. Comply, understand, and support corporate safety initiatives to ensure a safe work environment.EducationBS degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Business Administration, or related field or equivalent work experience in heavy civil construction.Work ExperienceFive (5) to ten (10) years progressive project experience in heavy civil environments.Minimum of five (5) years experience in roadway construction operationsKnowledge, skills, and abilitiesKnowledge of construction paving, underground, concrete and grading practices.Knowledge and understanding of union agreements and prevailing wage issues.Maintain ability to work in high production environment.Demonstrated decision-making skills.Excellent leadership skills.Excellent supervisory communication and organizational skills.Accuracy at all times.Physical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit and use hands to operate a computer keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Subject to outside working conditions. At times will be working around large construction equipment, must be safety conscience.Additional Requirements/SkillsAbility to abide by Granite’s Code of Conduct on a daily basis.A team player.About Granite Construction IncorporatedGranite Construction Incorporated is a member of the S&P 400 Index and is the parent company of Granite Construction Company, one of the nation's largest heavy civil contractors and construction materials producers. Granite Construction is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities and a Drug-Free Workplace. For additional information on applicant/employee rights please click here.Since 1922, Granite Construction has continued its long standing commitment to building some of America’s largest infrastructure projects including highways, bridges, dams, rail, and power. Recognized as one of the top 25 largest construction companies in the U.S., Granite specializes in complex infrastructure projects and provides award-winning construction services in mining, earthwork, water/sewer, power, tunneling, rail, highway and bridge construction. Granite also produces construction materials-sand, gravel, ready-mix, recycled asphalt product and asphalt concrete, and is a proven leader in alternative procurement project delivery.At Granite, our employees are our most valued asset and we are passionate about retaining, developing, and recruiting the best talent available. Our employees reflect our core values: Honesty, Integrity, Fairness, Accountability, Consideration of Others, Pursuit of Excellence, Reliability Safety and Citizenship and we are continuously looking for individuals who possess a winning attitude and share our Core Values. In exchange, we help you build a career that no other company can duplicate. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued. Add our award winning safety program, ethics, reputation, and a commitment to continuous improvement and you’ll see that we are building more than infrastructure—together, we are building your future.Notice to Staffing AgenciesGranite Construction, Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Granite") will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to Granite, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Granite mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Granite employees, or to Granite's resume database will be considered Granite property. Granite will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Granite will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. Agencies must obtain advance written approval from Granite's recruiting function to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract for service and in response to a specific job opening. Granite will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement in place. Agency agreements will only be valid if in writing and signed by Granite's Human Resources Representative or his/ her designee. No other Granite employee is authorized to bind Granite to any agreement regarding the placement of candidates by Agencies.Area of Interest ConstructionPrimary Location US-VA-ChesapeakeSchedule Full-time

title: Senior RDT&E Project Manager
description: Applied Research Associates, Inc. is seeking a Senior Project Manager to provide on-site Research, Development, Test and Evaluation (RDT&E) support in support of a Department of Defense (DoD) customer. The applicant will work intimately with teams supporting research and analysis in microelectronics, artificial intelligence, machine learning, autonomy, energy and power, software engineering, networking, communication, cyber, electronic warfare, aerial/ground/naval platforms, biotechnology, and space systems. This position will primarily involve customer stakeholder requirements and expectation management; problem identification and resolution involving both the DoD client and the team; risk identification and mitigation development; technical performance measurement; task and deliverable classification and tracking; quality management and subcontractor quality auditing; change management; business marketing and development; and customer relationship management.The successful candidate:Conducts technical gap analysis: tradeoff, performance, risk, threat; technology development, test and evaluation, logistic support analysis, and Technical Data development.Develops project plans and cost estimates for pending customer requested projects. Identifies and coordinates assignment of project teams. Allocates resources to subordinate project teams.Directs a multi-disciplinary team of scientists and engineers usually within a matrix organization, monitoring and encouraging functional organizations to complete milestones within specific budgets and schedules.Assists higher level program/project manager in directing the project life cycle by assisting in development of comprehensive project plans to include both long and short-range goals and milestones. Identifies, acquires, and utilizes company resources to achieve project technical objectives.Defines and analyze project requirements through onsite interaction with customer stakeholders. Assists in development of task order performance plans and schedules.Creates and implements a Program Management Plan and sub-plans.Implements project change management and control. Establishes project performance metrics that ensure successful completion of the project tasks. Assesses the project impacts of scope, schedule and budget change requests and recommends needed action. Helps ensures the project is maintained within scope, budget and schedule of the baseline agreement.Creates and implements the Stakeholder Management Plan to include conflict identification, resolution, need identification and stakeholder communication.Proactively communicates with the clients to ensure they are an integral part of the project for clarification of requirements and regular assessment of implementation progress.Maintains a daily status of all team requirements, and in the development of program metrics for cost, schedule and performance tracking and customer satisfaction.Prepares and presents presentations to internal management and to external customers to provide reviews and updates on technical, cost, and schedule aspects. Supports development and communication of Monthly Status reporting as required by the customer.Responsible for project risk identification and planning. Applies processes and procedures to identify, analyze, classify and prioritize program risks to formulate a risk management plan that assigns responsibility, determines approaches and specifies mitigation approaches and contingencies in the risk management process. Help identify risks and appropriate mitigations activities.Required Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in a physical science, management, finance, or mathematics and 10+ years of Project Management experience in government defense acquisition programs.Strong understanding in planning, developing and resourcing a WBS, constructing an IMS, developing project performance metrics and implementation of Earned Value Metrics.Ability to identify, communicate and manage stakeholders. Ability to root out customer needs and expectations and to effectively manage and resolve conflict.Strong writing, speaking, and interpersonal skills.Work experience with Intelligence, Defense Department, or Air Force Space programs.Proficient in using Microsoft Office tools: Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint.US citizen with a minimum DoD Top Secret clearance and the ability to obtain SCI accessDesired Qualifications:Current DoD TS/SCI security clearanceAcquisition or Research Development experience in areas such as microelectronics, artificial intelligence, machine learning, autonomy, energy and power, software engineering, networking, communication, cyber, electronic warfare, aerial/ground/naval platforms, biotechnology, and space systems.This position is contingent upon award of a contract expected in Spring 2020 supporting the Department of Defense.COMPANY INFORMATION:Applied Research Associates, Inc. is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. The company, founded in Albuquerque, NM, in 1979, currently employs over 1200 professionals. ARA offices throughout the United States and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense technologies, civil technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. The corporation also provides sophisticated technical products for environmental site characterization, pavement analysis, and robotics.At ARA, employees are our greatest assets. The corporation realizes that employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels. ARA gives its employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take more active roles as owners. The culture is challenging; innovation and experimentation are the norm. Employees are eligible for contributions which not only add to the company’s success, but also their own through the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please visit our website at www.ara.com.Please apply at www.careers.ara.com for the Senior RDT&E Project Manager position.EducationRequiredBachelors or better in Management or related fieldBehaviorsRequiredLeader: Inspires teammates to follow themTeam Player: Works well as a member of a groupDetail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done wellDedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrityMotivationsRequiredSelf-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside helpEqual Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with DisabilitiesThe contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Principal Software Engineering Manager
description: Every once in a while, a job comes along that will positively affect the experience of everyone who uses Microsoft products. If you’ve been waiting for the opportunity to lead a team to do this, this is the job for you! Azure Identity is searching for a new leader in the Identity Governance Team who can blaze new ground in increasing employee productivity by helping us achieve our goal to allow the right users to have the right access to the right resources while allowing IT to delegate protecting, monitoring this access to Azure Identity and supporting their audit and compliance requirements. We are making a big impact directly to external customers and across Microsoft where this advanced self-service governance capability is critically needed.We are at a critical time in bringing up the service into production and are looking for an experienced and passionate engineering manager to lead a team to manage the service at a large global scale with very high throughput. The team delivers cross-cutting features such as request, approval workflows, JIT, notifications, auditing and Machine learning based insights for the various Microsoft and Azure resources usage and access patterns.ResponsibilitiesThis is a broad cross-team role with high visibility, collaborating with multiple teams across Microsoft.Lead the architecture, design and implementation of services managing governance capabilities for extremely high scale, throughput, durability, and low latency.Innovate and make service deployment and maintenance an efficient well-oiled machine that provides excellent reliability with minimal manual engineer intervention.Lead the definition of requirements, KPIs, priorities and planning of engineering deliverables.Mentor and grow the energetic, diverse, and driven team with a good mix of senior, mid-level, and junior talent.QualificationsBasic Qualifications10+ years of professional software development experience demonstrating responsibilities identified above.3+ years of experience in leading an engineering team.Preferred QualificationsThese skills are highly valued:Expertise in design, building and operating large scale distributed systems that can sustain rapid growthTechnical leadership, experience in high performing, agile teamsDrive changes across multiple teams across MicrosoftGreat communication skills to collaborate cross-group and work effectively within the teamExpertise in any modern continuous delivery/deployment systemsExpertise with Service Fabric, ARM, EV2, dSTS, dSMS, Microsoft Cloud/AzureAbility to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Industrial Automation Account Manager/Sales Engineer
description: Account ManagerOmron Automation - Americas is looking for an energetic and focused Account Manager in the Richmond, VA area to manage the sale of all Industrial Automation products in the territory.Responsibilities: · Increase Omron sales through a fundamental knowledge of entire portfolio of products and applications including Industrial Components, Automation Technologies and Safety solutions to help customers solve problems.· Develop meaningful relationships with customers and distributors within a specified geographic region.· Through appropriate investigation, understand customer needs intimately and work with Omron team members to offer bundled solutions that resolve known issues and can be replicated to other customers.· Conduct market analysis and create development plan for the region to optimize sales coverage with other Omron sales members and existing distributors.· In conjunction with Omron sales management, establish target accounts and sales goals for distributors and their sales people that match Omron's product and application competencies, and create a mutual action plan.· In conjunction with Omron sales management, conduct reviews with assigned distributors to review progress per established plan. Coordinate sales efforts, administer distributor leads, and manage the transition of accounts and business where it is deemed necessary.· Manage a "Sales Funnel" or "Rolling Job Log" of the incremental opportunities for Omron Electronics in the territory.· Makes joint sales calls with distributors where there is significant opportunity for Omron Electronics. Provide "on the job" training to distributor sales personnel on Omron products and sale skills.· Complete assigned reporting activities in a timely manner.· Represent Omron in a professional, ethical, and socially responsible manner.· Represents the Omron Guiding Principles through personal and business interactions with employees, customers, distributors, and colleagues.Requirements: · Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business, Marketing or related field.· Five (5) years of experience in sales of industrial automation or similar products.· Five (5) years of experience managing distributors or distribution channel.· Sales experience with some or all of the following products: Machine Vision Systems, Motion Control (Servos, Drives, Controllers and Motors), PLC/HMI (hardware, software and interfaces), Components (Sensors, Relays and Switches), Safety (Light Curtains, Controllers, Sensors and E-Stops) and Auto ID (Barcode and RFID) and Robotics.· Ability to evaluate the financial strength of a business.· Ability to conduct market analysis to determine business opportunities and market penetration.· Energetic, aggressive, focused and a highly motivated self-starter.· Strong relationship builder and a strong personal desire to win.· Ability to multi-task and work cross-functionally with strong organizational skills.· Team player mentality but able to work independently as required.· Strong interpersonal, listening, questioning and communication skills (written and oral).The Company: *******2014-2019 National Best and Brightest Company to Work For!*******2013-2019 Winner for one of the 75 Best Places to Work in Illinois!*******2011-2019 Winner for one of the 101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For in Chicago!Omron Automation - Americas is a leading global manufacturer of industrial automation products focused on sensing and control technologies. We serve OEM machine builders and end users with a wide range of products that integrate easily into complete automation solutions, offer simple connectivity, and are backed by solid support services. Our extensive product groups which are primarily manufactured overseas include programmable controllers, robotics, servo motors and drives, operator interfaces, temperature controllers, sensors, inspection and machine vision systems, RFID track and trace systems, safety devices, and software.Omron Automation -- Americas, headquartered in Hoffman Estates, Illinois, is the Americas industrial automation subsidiary of Omron Corporation, a $8 billion global technology company celebrating more than 80 years of success. Led by a management team where each member has 20+ years of experience in Industrial Automation, we are a midsize firm with a corporate culture of challenge, ethics and innovation. As we strive to grow the company and our market share, this position offers the potential to make a solid impact on the organization.Omron's corporate core value of "working for the benefit of society" applies to our unique technical competencies in the areas of industrial automation, safety, security, environmental protection and healthcare in pursuit of a brighter future for all. As a corporate citizen that has long recognized and encouraged the importance of giving back to local communities and helping those less fortunate, Omron has demonstrated this over the years by designing a manufacturing facility which employs the disabled, making donations to aide those impacted by natural disasters, and sponsoring an annual Founders Day in which employees volunteer in the local communities across the globeOur Commitment to Employees: · Company Culture defined as a fast paced, multi-tasking, team focused empowerment of employees, creative, innovative and open communication type organization.· Training and Career Development Program to give employees a learning path with the necessary tools and resources they need to help build their career at Omron.· Great financial opportunities with competitive compensation, immediate 401k match with 100% vesting, profit sharing, and Blue Cross Blue Shield for medical, dental, vision and prescription drug benefits.· Community Awareness that includes activities with local non-profit organizations and a Matching Gift Program.· Work-Life Balance with Flexible Work Arrangements, Flexible Work Hours, and Sick/Vacation/Holiday Pay.· Wellness Activities such as Walking Contests, Nutritional Learning Sessions, On Site Flu shots and Health Screenings.Omron Automation- Americas is an equal opportunity employer.Job Type: Full-timeAdditional Compensation:BonusesOther formsBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time offFlexible scheduleParental leaveProfessional development assistanceOtherVisa Sponsorship Potentially Available:No: Not providing sponsorship for this jobSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:automation.omron.com

title: Senior Product Manager
description: Interos, founded by Jennifer Bisceglie, is one of the most transformative technologically advanced platforms that powers the global economy supply chain. By using ML and big data, Interos aspires to dynamically and continuously map all of a company's business relationships to multiple tiers of dependency on a global scale and endeavors to help customers understand risk in their multi-tier, global supply chains. The scope of this value proposition extends across a variety of different technology sectors including risk management, supply chain intelligence, financial intelligence and cyber-security. Interos has raised $26M in total funding from Venrock, led by Nick Beim, and Kleiner Perkins, led by Ted Schlein. We have 70+ employees and are poised to double in size by end of 2020. Our offices are headquartered in Arlington, VA and we have presence in Menlo Park, CA.We need an extraordinary team member who thrives as part of a fast-paced team and takes pride in their ability to succeed while delivering value to our customers. Be challenged by innovation and grow professionally by solving one of the most interesting challenges impacting businesses across the globe.The Opportunity:As the Senior Product Manager you will support the product management team define and maintain our product road-map . This individual contributor role will include planning and execution throughout the product life cycle including gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements and working with customers across the company to ensure product innovation, revenue growth and customer satisfaction goals are met.We are looking for a Senior Product Manager who thrives on cross-team collaboration in a fast-paced organization and being the business leader that drives innovative solutions and programs to success. Bring your organizational and process driven creativity and your extroverted compulsion to talk to, learn from, and evangelize everyone. We know that you make things happen. Make them happen here!Key Responsibilities:Develop the long-term product and technology vision for the Interos data science and analytics platforms including data infrastructure and machine learningBuild and implement process around the data infrastructure, platform engineers and data scientists responsible for executing the Product team's requirementsA strong drive to support the development of the product strategy, go-to-market plans, and product design documents (concept document, business case, product requirements)An understanding of how to capture, understand and translate customer and market feedback into actionable user storiesAn understanding of how to create product road maps and plans that address key market needsAn understanding how to distill market research and customer feedback to provide perspective to the product team and product road mapUnderstand the changing third party risk management landscape and integrate movements into product strategies and roadmapsCollaborate with UI/UX team to create design concepts and with Engineering to implement and iterate on these conceptsTrack usage performance to iterate and further improve the business*Qualifications:7+ years of enterprise (ideally SaaS) software experience;3+ years of product management experienceBachelor's degree in Business, Marketing or Computer ScienceEagerness and self-starting approach and an entrepreneurial mindsetProblem-solving, organizational, analytical, and critical thinking skillsExperience in data science, analytics, machine learning and system architectureDemonstrated business savvy and technical skills, and ability to think strategically and execute tacticallyExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExperience working in cross-functional collaborative environmentsKnowledge or experience with Agile methodology to drive product development and deliveryProven ability to take initiative and to build strong and productive relationshipsEntrepreneurial and resourceful with the ability to handle numerous projects concurrentlyFocused on providing excellent customer experiences ensure high end-user satisfactionBENEFITS:Comprehensive Health & Wellness package (Medical, Dental and Vision)10 Paid Holiday Days OffAccrued Paid Time Off (PTO)401(k) Employer MatchingStock OptionsCareer advancement opportunitiesCasual DressHackathonsOn-site gym and dedicated Peloton room at headquartersCompany Events (Sports Games, Fitness Competitions, Birthday Celebrations, Contests, Happy Hours)Annual company partyEmployee Referral ProgramInteros is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other classification protected by law.If you are a candidate in need of assistance or an accommodation in the application process, please contact HR@interos.ai ( HR@interos.net )
