title: Principal Engineering Manager - Threat Detection Engineering
description: Principal Engineering Manager – Threat Detection Engineering; Digital Security and Risk EngineeringCore Services Engineering builds and manages the critical products and services that Microsoft runs on. We boldly pursue big ideas that power transformational advances at Microsoft and for our customers, while helping Microsoft teams work smarter, faster and more securely every day. Core Services Engineering employees have deep technical and business expertise, customer insights, and a clear point of view that comes from first-hand, large-scale experience with Microsoft and industry solutions. We are engineers, technology leaders and experts, digital transformation change agents, and customer advocates. We have exciting opportunities for you to innovate, influence, transform, inspire and grow within our organization and we encourage you to apply to learn more!Digital Security and Risk Engineering (DSRE) is looking for an experienced Engineering Leader to drive Microsoft’s Enterprise Threat Detection and Security Monitoring programs. These functions are responsible for turning billions of alerts each day into actionable insight for our Security Operations Center (SOC), end users, and applications and services teams. The primary responsibilities of the role include: developing threat detection and monitoring strategies; creating a road-map of prioritized requirements, outcomes, and milestones; collaborating with partner and stakeholder teams across the enterprise; building detections and managing the infrastructure and services that comprise our monitoring ecosystem; engaging with response teams; developing and tracking key performance indicators and metrics; and communicating progress and status to executive leadership.The successful candidate will have experience building and leading enterprise security engineering functions. You will need to demonstrate a deep understanding and expertise with the engineering process used to build and manage hyper-scale monitoring solutions as well as risk management, data science, security investigation methodologies, and security incident response. The ideal candidate will be able to influence without authority, drive strong alignment across multiple teams, and make a strong business case for features and functionality that will enhance the program and reduce risk to the enterprise.US citizenship is required for the position. US Federal Government clearances are a plus and the successful candidate without clearance will need to apply.ResponsibilitiesKey responsibilities:Manage and modernize existing enterprise platforms, including 1st party, 3rd party and custom-built technologies.Lead the development and engineering of detections, including heuristics and machine learning models.Develop compelling reporting that identifies threats and risks and drives the right actions to re-mediate.Attract and develop key talent on the team.QualificationsRequired Qualifications:Must be a US citizen capable of obtaining and maintaining a US Government security clearance.Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience.5+ years of work experience as a Program Manager in a security-related domain, or equivalent leadership experience.Preferred Qualifications:Experience running an enterprise scale security program across a large, global, complex organization.Active US Government security clearance.Experience leading the development of technical solutions in a modern engineering environment.Extensive leadership skills with excellent communication skills at all organization levels.Ability to influence others without authority.CERT Insider Threat or similar security certifications (SANS, ISC2)PMP (PMI)Experience in any of the following areas: user behavior analytics, security analytics, digital forensics, and/or data loss prevention.The ideal candidate will have experience in a team environment, designing and building enterprise scale engineering services that detect and re-mediate security threats. The candidate should have demonstrated technical depth with Microsoft’s product and service telemetry, security services, data/analytics platforms, and agile development practices. In addition, this position requires an individual who can demonstrate the ability to ensure highly resilient and scalable service designs and processes through partnership with other teams across the company.Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements is required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:Citizenship Verification: This position requires verification of US citizenship to meet federal government security clearance requirements.#DSRE#CSEOMicrosoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Project Manager II- Power
description: Project Manager II- Power(Job Number: 2000010X)Building a career at Granite may be the most valuable thing you could do...Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to build your career and personal brand? If so, then you’ve come to the right place!Since 1922, Granite Construction has continued its long standing commitment to building some of America’s largest infrastructure projects including highways, bridges, dams, rail, and power. Recognized as one of the top 25 largest construction companies in the U.S., Granite specializes in complex infrastructure projects and provides award-winning construction services in mining, earthwork, water/sewer, power, tunneling, rail, highway and bridge construction. Granite also produces construction materials-sand, gravel, ready-mix, recycled asphalt product and asphalt concrete, and is a proven leader in alternative procurement project delivery.At Granite, our employees are our most valued asset and we are passionate about retaining, developing, and recruiting the best talent available. Our employees reflect our core values: Honesty, Integrity, Fairness, Accountability, Consideration of Others, Pursuit of Excellence, Reliability Safety and Citizenship and we are continuously looking for individuals who possess a winning attitude and share our Core Values. In exchange, we help you build a career that no other company can duplicate. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued. Add our award winning safety program, ethics, reputation, and a commitment to continuous improvement and you’ll see that we are building more than infrastructure—together, we are building your future.General SummaryThe Project Manager II will be responsible for the overall direction, completion and financial outcome for industrial or heavy industrial EPC projects. The ideal candidate will have previous experience with EPC/GC/CMGC/OE high voltage T&D construction, utility staff augmentation, material management, testing & commissioning, renewable power generation or civil engineering.Essential Job AccountabilitiesPerform accurate project revenue and cost financial forecasting to ensure corporate profitability goals are met.Coordinate with estimators and project controls group to establish budget.Lead estimating efforts on vertically integrated projects to ensure accurate and consistent bid to build process.Coordinate efforts with estimators, large project sponsor, and manager of construction to manage resources to meet project schedule.Participate in bid review and bid closing to ensure accuracy of bid and evaluate project feasibility; work with estimating team to develop bid schedule.Coordinate with large project sponsor, manager of construction and project team to develop comprehensive plan for project start up and successful kick-off.Provide environment where dynamic project communication occurs between Project Engineers, Foremen, Superintendents and Construction Manager to ensure work is accomplished in an efficient, profitable, and safe manner.Ensure proper job controls, i.e. quantities, costs, revenue and schedule.Establish and maintain working relationships with owners, agencies, subcontractors, corporate management, inspectors, etc., providing customer service to develop long-term partnerships with client base.Ensure accurate construction reports for the job allowing for continuous improvement in performance.Run projects at profitability levels to meet or exceed expected margins.Comply, understand, and support corporate safety initiatives to ensure a safe work environment.#LI-ML1EducationBS degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Business Administration,Electrical Engineering or related field or equivalent work experience in heavy civil construction.Work ExperienceFive (5) to ten (10) years progressive project experience in EPC/GC/CMGC/OE high voltage T&D and or heavy civil environments.Knowledge, skills, and abilitiesMaintain ability to work in high production environment.Demonstrated decision-making skills.Excellent leadership skills.Excellent supervisory communication and organizational skills.Accuracy at all times.Physical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit and use hands to operate a computer keyboard. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Subject to outside working conditions. At times will be working around large construction equipment, must be safety conscience.Additional Requirements/SkillsAbility to abide by Granite’s Code of Conduct on a daily basis.A team player.About Granite Construction IncorporatedGranite Construction Incorporated is a member of the S&P 400 Index and is the parent company of Granite Construction Company, one of the nation's largest heavy civil contractors and construction materials producers. Granite Construction is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities and a Drug-Free Workplace. For additional information on applicant/employee rights please click here.Notice to Staffing AgenciesGranite Construction, Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Granite") will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to Granite, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Granite mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to Granite employees, or to Granite's resume database will be considered Granite property. Granite will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Granite will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees. Agencies must obtain advance written approval from Granite's recruiting function to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract for service and in response to a specific job opening. Granite will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement in place. Agency agreements will only be valid if in writing and signed by Granite's Human Resources Representative or his/ her designee. No other Granite employee is authorized to bind Granite to any agreement regarding the placement of candidates by Agencies. #LI-ML1Area of Interest ConstructionPrimary Location US-WA-VancouverSchedule Full-time

title: Principal Data Science Manager
description: Are you interested in working on one of the most exciting products at Microsoft, passionate about exceeding customer expectations and advancing Microsoft's cloud first strategy? Do you thrive in a start-up like environment, want to learn more about cloud computing technologies and drive growth in one of Microsoft's core businesses? If so, then look no further than the Azure Customer Experience (CXP) Team!Microsoft Azure provides customers with an on-demand and infinitely scalable infrastructure and platform for customers to build, host, and scale service applications on the Internet through Microsoft’s global data centers. As part of the Azure Engineering organization, Azure CXP is a rapidly growing team committed to transforming Azure customers into Azure fans.Our Azure CXP Data Science team is critical to this pursuit. Through the development of innovative models and advanced data analysis, they enable our Azure business programs and services to more effectively and efficiently engage and care for our customers. Some examples of the team’s current projects include Azure customer health modeling, an answer recommendation model for technical Azure questions, support case volume forecasting, support queue anomaly detection and customer identification for migration/deployment assistance.The team partners with business programs, software engineers and other data science teams to deliver these solutions and identify many additional high impact opportunities for the data scientists to contribute to the Azure business.We are looking for an experienced data science or engineering manager, who brings great teamwork, cross-functional and high energy leadership, positive attitude, strategic vision and a focus on execution, to lead our Azure CXP Data Science team and take a leading role in driving customer obsession within Azure through data.ResponsibilitiesLead the Azure CXP data science team to develop innovative models and deliver insightful data analytics that optimize how Azure engages and cares for our customers.Design, develop, and evaluate production-quality models using the latest in machine learning and natural language processing techniques.Work with engineering and program management teams to manage integration of models and algorithms into production systems.Collaborate closely with other data science teams across Azure and Microsoft to share solutions and maximize business impact.Engage Azure business owners to identify data science needs, communicate plans and presents results in a highly consumable manner.Investigate new technologies and prototype novel concepts.Establish a long-term view and manage a portfolio of research projects for your team.Grow the Data Science team by hiring the best and developing existing team members.Create a collaborative environment where data scientists can thrive, regardless of seniority or discipline.QualificationsBasic Qualifications:Masters or PhD degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields (Undergraduates with significant appropriate experience will be considered).10+ years of engineering or data science experience.5+ years of people management experience.Preferred Qualifications:Demonstrated ability to build and grow high-performing teams, and passion for creating a diverse and inclusive culture.Demonstrated ability to work across teams, executives and subject matter experts to drive results.Combination of strategic vision and focus on iterative delivery through clearly defined processes and schedules.Aptitude for breaking down complex business and technical problems and developing solutions and processes for addressing these problems.Inherently curious and energized by large challenges and making an impact on a globally scaled business.Known as highly collaborative and for helping colleagues succeed, whether they are peers, direct reports or managers.Thrive in fast-paced, agile environmentsStrong verbal and written communication and presentation skillsExperience with large data environments.Experience with Azure or other cloud providers is a plus.#azcxpAbility to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work. #AzCXP

title: Data & Applied Scientist Manager
description: At Microsoft, we believe breakthrough technology is created by constant experimentation, fearless exploration, and a commitment to long-term innovation. That’s where you come in! Lead our Experience Analytics practice with a team of 8 outstanding data scientists to define and design the future of Microsoft’s cloud products and business applications—Microsoft Azure, Dynamics 365, Power BI, Power Apps, and more.The businessIn Cloud + AI product design studios, we work hard, have fun, and deeply value collaboration and individuality in each other. As a team, we’re passionate about maximizing the impact of data science work on product design, usability, and engineering decisions. The mission of the Experience Analytics team is to leverage product telemetry to unpack the nuances behind our customers’ end-to-end journeys and drive design decisions.The team + roleYou’re an experienced data science leader who’s passionate about improving product design through experience analytics, who brings strategic vision, cross-functional leadership, great teamwork, pragmatic optimism, and a focus on execution. Your dream job is driving customer obsession and product quality through data.Data scientists in the Experience Analytics team influence product strategy to more effectively and delightfully engage our customers by developing innovative models and advanced data analysis. Some examples of the team’s projects include user journey and usage funnel visualization and analysis, behavior-based persona clustering, and Net Promoter Score driver regression analysis. The Experience Analytics team partners closely with the different product design and user research disciplines, as well as the product teams and data science teams in other orgs.ResponsibilitiesDay-to-day work:Lead the Cloud + AI Experience Analytics data science team to develop innovative models and deliver insightful data analytics that empower cloud and business application products to improve user experience through data.Engage Cloud + AI design directors and business owners to identify data science needs, communicate plans, and present results in a highly consumable manner.Work with and guide engineering and program management teams to build and manage solid data infrastructure to enable data science work.Establish short-term and long-term vision and manage a portfolio of research projects for the Experience Analytics team.Grow the Data Science team by hiring top talent and growing your existing team members.Create a collaborative environment where data scientists can thrive, regardless of seniority.Collaborate closely with other data science teams across the Cloud + AI division and Microsoft to share solutions and maximize business impact.Design, develop, and evaluate production-quality models using the latest machine learning techniques.QualificationsQualificationsMasters or PhD degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field. (Candidates with a bachelor’s and significant appropriate experience will also be considered.)10+ years of data science and/or engineering experience5+ years of people management experienceSkillsDemonstrated ability to build and grow high-performing and multidisciplinary teams of Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Analysts—and passion for creating a diverse and inclusive culture.Demonstrated ability to work across teams, executives, and subject matter experts to drive results.Combination of strategic vision and focus on iterative delivery through clearly defined processes and schedules.Aptitude for breaking down complex business and technical problems and developing solutions and processes for addressing these problems.Experience working throughout the full lifecycle of Data Science projects with large data environments—from raw data collection and data pipeline building to data analysis and modeling.Skilled at applying data science methodologies to investigate and understand human behavior, specifically in the context of digital product usage.Known as highly collaborative and for helping colleagues succeed—whether they are peers, direct reports, or other leaders and managers.Thrive in fast-paced, agile environments.Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills.Experience working within product design or other user experience disciplines.Familiarity with Microsoft internal data stack (COSMOS, Aria, Data Studio), Azure, or other cloud providers.If your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying. Experience comes in many forms—skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply. Be sure to include links to both your LinkedIn profile and your portfolio of relevant projects.We can't wait to hear from you, and we're eager to see all the great things we'll create together!Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Senior Hardware program Manager
description: Do you want to play a key role in delivering cutting edge technology to Azure? Are you fascinated by the flexibility and agility of deploying FPGA solutions? Do you like collaborative environments? Does helping to create the infrastructure that powers Microsoft's online services excite you?Azure’s Cloud Hardware Infrastructure Engineering (CHIE) team is responsible for the definition, design, and development and deployment of Azure Hardware solutions for the datacenter. We work closely with Microsoft product groups, researchers, suppliers and industry partners to architect, develop and build hardware solutions and deliver new technology innovation (Machine learning hardware, new storage and network paradigms,). We focus on delivering solutions required for our cloud service platforms at the lowest possible cost of ownership (TCO). We are industry-leading in developing custom device solutions to accelerate production workloads in the datacenter.This Program Management Role supports our Azure FPGA solutions. Learn more about Azure’s deployment of FPGAs across the fleet here: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/resources/videos/build-2017-inside-the-microsoft-fpga-based-configurable-cloud/ and here https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/project/project-catapult/ResponsibilitiesThe CHIE Program Management team is looking for a Technical Program Manager invested in Azure FPGA infrastructure deployment, with a track record coordinating FPGA RTL and/or Driver development and release. You will be working with a group of talented engineers to manage and coordinate the delivery of the RTL, utilities, and drivers that support our innovative cloud services. This role will focus on understanding internal customer needs in the context of Azure’s FPGA solutions, planning and scheduling of software/RTL execution, validation, release, and update, tracking a feature release roadmap and reporting the status to the leadership team.As an experienced program manager, you must have a strong desire, passion, and ability to understand customer needs and a willingness to develop efficient processes and practices that deliver on a schedule and a level of quality that delights our customers and exceed their expectations.QualificationsRequired experience:Bachelors required. MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science desired5+ years of experience as a Technical Program Manager with 2+ years of Program Management experience in FPGA RTL development or release, driver development or release , or equivalent experience with firmware or VLSI.A proven track-record of shipping products and having been through at least one development cycleExperience with agile project management methodology, Azure Dev Ops, JIRA, or similar toolsKnowledge of test, debug and validation cyclesAbility to deal with ambiguity, prioritize multiple strategic and tactical options, and drive issues to closure with a high bar on qualityExperience in management of complex cross-functional, cross-business, cross-disciplinary projectsTechnical savvy. Know how to solve the hard problems, and demonstrate ability to work independentlyPreferred experience:Experience with Cloud Hardware developmentData center hardware/software project experience from inception to go liveSW development experience for storage or networking technologiesUnderstanding of FPGA devices architecture and toolsAbility to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Sr. Product Manager - Customer Self-Service Products
description: 5+ years of relevant work experience in product management and project management.Proficient knowledge of Product Management principles and processes.Experience developing internet products and technologies.Bachelor DegreeAmazon’s mission is to be ‘Earth’s most customer-centric company’, and our award-winning Customer Service (CS) team is an essential part of that mission. Amazon CS is one of the largest customer service organizations in the world. Our tens of thousands of Customer Service Associates around the globe provide world-class support to customers 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, and in over 15 languages (and growing).The Customer Engagement Technologies (CET) organization powers CS by developing customer-facing products to help customers resolve their issue before reaching out to a human Customer Service Associate (CSA). If the customers do reach out to a CSA, we aspire to ensure that the contact is handled seamlessly and elegantly.Our team is looking for a talented and experienced Product Manager to work across CET Technical Development, Operations, Machine Learning, UX Design, CS Business Verticals (e.g. Digital, Shipping and Delivery Services) and other Amazon teams to improve customer self-service experiences. Specifically, you will be continuously re-thinking, challenging and innovating Amazon’s customer self-service experience, identifying and prioritizing which customer contact type use cases to go after, designing an elegant and effective customer self-service journey, and optimizing the seamless integration of this experience with the corresponding automation and Customer Service Associate channels.You will be part of a Global Product Management team whose innovations and strategies will influence what we build and how we surface information to solve customers’ issues globally. You will partner with teams of software development engineers, machine learning scientists, data scientists, UX designers and researchers to create, execute and iterate on experiences to help solve the needs of customers who contact Amazon CS.A successful candidate is an effective communicator, has demonstrated the ability to earn the trust of stakeholders across a cross-functional team of individuals, is data-driven, has a strong eye for opportunities and has experience managing complex business and technical challenges. You are customer obsessed and not afraid to get your hands dirty navigating requirements from different business teams. title: Senior Engineering Manager, Software Development
description: BS in Computer Science with at least 10 years of industry experience.At least 6 years of experience managing enterprise software engineering teams.Technically credible to lead a team of world class software engineers and development managers and be able to deliver the right product with a scalable engineering design.The ability to achieve results in a fast-paced environment is critical.A passion for people management and mentorship; hiring and developing technical leadersAble to balance technical leadership with sound business judgment.Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical executionExcellent verbal and written communication skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skillsHave you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrives you wonder how did the product reach from manufacturers to you and how is Amazon able to deliver such a large selection of products at low cost to your doorstep? Our systems use real time, large scale optimization techniques to automatically procure and source the product from suppliers and optimize the flow of goods across the supply chain to minimize the cost and lead time for customers. Our team is focused on saving hundreds of millions of dollars using cutting edge science, machine learning, and scalable distributed software on the Cloud that automates and optimizes supply chain under the uncertainty of demand, pricing and supply.Our team is part of Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technology (SCOT) group and we are looking for a passionate, results oriented, and customer obsessed technical leader to lead our efforts in building the next generation of software systems for Inbound Optimization. As part of SCOT, we design and build systems to optimize Amazon’s supplier network, and manage the flow of inbound products across our global fulfillment network. We do this for millions of SKUs, for hundreds of product lines worth billions of dollars of inventory procured world-wide. Our systems are built entirely in-house, and are on the cutting edge in automated large scale supply chain planning, optimization, and simulation. We are unique in that we’re simultaneously developing the science of supply chain planning and solving some of the toughest computational challenges at Amazon. Unlike many companies who buy existing off-the-shelf planning systems, we are responsible for studying, designing, and building systems to suit Amazon’s needs. Our team members have an opportunity to be on the forefront of supply chain thought leadership by working on some of the most difficult problems in the industry with some of the best product managers, research scientists/statisticians/economists and software engineers. Our software is used by every country Amazon services, and is a critical link to ensuring the products our customers want are available when they need them, and in helping us reduce costs for both Amazon and our vendor partners.We are looking for leader of leaders who is passionate about building teams and cloud-scale systems from the ground up, and who want to help shape the roadmap for Amazon’s world-class supply chain management systems. As one of the senior leaders on our team, you’ll work closely with our engineering group, research scientists, and our executive team to design and execute your team’s product roadmap to support Amazon's rapidly expanding retail portfolio and merchant portfolio. You will lead efforts to improve your team’s performance and stability, drive recruiting and team building, developing and growing leaders, and help foster Amazon’s developer-oriented culture.Successful candidates will have an established track record of building and managing large teams to deliver complex distributed software systems, keen technical aptitude, excellent project management skills, solid communication skills, and be driven to achieve results in a fast paced environment.We have a team culture that encourages innovation and expect developers and management alike to take high degree of ownership for the product vision, technical architecture and project delivery. You will act as a leader who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. You are proactive in removing roadblocks, pave the way for innovation, and can handle multiple competing priorities. You are an experienced software development leader who understands and sets a high bar for all parts of the software development and deployment lifecycle, including design, development, documentation, testing and operations. You work hand-in-hand with finance and business leaders. You will be responsible for implementing a product vision while satisfying scalability, reliability, performance, and budget goals. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical ideas in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences including senior leadership.Has developed innovative solutions for optimization problemsExperience with analytics and large data sets

title: Senior Product Manager, Discovery Platform & Search
description: Hulu is the leading premium streaming service offering live and on-demand TV and movies, with and without commercials, both in and outside the home. This platform includes the services that enables Hulu browse, search, recommendations, content/user understanding, and machine learning analytics. You will partner with product managers in each area, architects, engineers, and researchers to help us figure out the investments and tradeoffs to enable new scale and market offerings. Hulu’s subscriber base has more than quintupled (5x growth) in the last 5 years— with that kind of growth and whatever is to come, it's imperative that we think about scale!You will also directly own our Search and Browse services and be responsible for defining the roadmap of improvements needed as well as anticipating any issues as we launch new content or live events.Your work will not only enable the corresponding user experiences within personalization— by exposing key services and building an accessible platform, you will empower other teams and organizations across Hulu.Our ideal team member is someone who loves data, and tricky technical challenges - and can partner effectively with highly technical engineering, research, and data science partners. Our future team member should also be able to 'zoom out,' applying business sense and strategy to ensure investments have meaningful business impact.This is not a theoretical job where your work is hidden behind the scenes — Discovery Platform touches the majority of the TV shows and movies users see when they launch our app and ultimately watch. title: Principal Product Manager
description: 10+ years of product management experienceBS in Computer Science or a related engineering fieldExperience leading cross-functional, cross domain projects with demonstrated expertise in leading without authority to achieve resultsAbility to communicate complex technical issues convincingly to a wide range of audiencesStrong leader who can prioritize and drive excellence within a talented, opinionated teamWell-honed analytical skills, comfortable working with data, and developing insights from it, experience establishing and tracking program metrics, and experience with experimental designExperience with financial modeling, for both cost and revenueUnrelenting tenacityAWS Wavelength provides developers the ability to build applications that serve end-users with single-digit millisecond latencies over the 5G network. Wavelength embeds AWS compute and storage services at the edge of telecommunications providers’ 5G networks, enabling developers to serve use-cases that require ultra-low latency like machine learning inference at the edge, autonomous industrial equipment, smart cars and cities, Internet of Things (IoT), and Augmented and Virtual Reality. Wavelength brings the power of AWS to the edge of the 5G network, so developers can deploy the portions of an application that require ultra-low latency within the 5G network, and then seamlessly connect back to the rest of their application and full range of cloud services running in AWS. AWS customers can now use the same familiar AWS APIs, tools, and functionality they use today, to deliver-low latency applications at the edge of the 5G network, around the world.We are seeking an entrepreneurial and innovative product and business leader for AWS Wavelength. If you are you passionate about how edge computing is revolutionizing the cloud and want to build the vision of how AWS will enable the next wave of ultra-low latency Internet applications, this is the role for you. As the product owner, you will head the product conceptualization and define the product roadmap for the new edge computing initiative. You will work backwards from the customer to understand the capabilities, programming model, and experience AWS will offer developers. You will work with internal AWS services and infrastructure teams to understand the unique challenges and constraints of the edge, and define the right product strategy and solutions to tackle them. You will do the product exploration and design, and work with a dedicated team of super talented engineers to build and launch the products you define. The role’s responsibilities also focus on building a global business through the development and management of strategic partnerships with telecommunications carriers. Here, you will drive Wavelength’s commercial vision in international markets and work closely with the technical field community and product management peers to ensure Wavelength has the right positioning, messaging, and enables compelling use cases across AWS’ overall edge computing platforms.You will drive the rhythm of the business and lead the organization through change, evolution, and sustained scaling. The right individual will aspire to become a leader with drive and competencies to scale Wavelength. You will lead by example, being just as passionate about operational performance and predictability as you are about all other aspects of the customer and partner experiences. You will not have the luxury of having tunnel-vision for any one area; rather, you will need to exhibit excellent judgment on how to prioritize between focusing on existing versus new customers and partners between business plans, features, architectural improvements and operational excellence.In return, you’ll be rewarded with the opportunity to work in a fun and challenging environment with a seasoned team of entrepreneurial leaders who are passionate about delighting customers and making history in the edge computing space.MBA or Master's DegreeExperience in cloud, edge computing, or mobile networking, along with a track record of turning ambiguous ideas into products and delivering novel cloud servicesWell-versed in commercial contracting approachesProvable and documented track record of taking ownership and driving actual business results (e.g. pipeline auditioning, revenue or margin increases, field and consumer program management with measurable results) for a business with > $10M revenueDemonstrated program ownership and consistent delivery on commitments - great organizational skills with exceptional follow through and attention to detailExperience identifying and resolving complex issues, and assuming leadership roles in unfamiliar or ambiguous circumstances - solid sense of accountability and sound personal judgment

title: Senior Manager, Technical Program Management – Build and Tools
description: Job CategoryProducts and TechnologyJob DetailsWhat you’ll be doing…As a Senior Manager, this role will have the opportunity to directly lead and influence the vision for Developer Tooling and Engineering Productivity infrastructure at Tableau. If you are passionate about technology, but also care deeply about enabling engineers to do something meaningful, this is the opportunity for you. In this leadership position, you will play a pivotal role in defining the developer experience and influencing the culture of the engineering team. With growing number of Tableau engineers, products and deployments, we need to provide our developers with the tools and infrastructure to innovate faster on our mission to help people see and understand their data.You will lead a team that owns key technical initiatives, including requirements gathering, feature definition, prioritization, go-live strategy, service quality monitoring and continual improvements. title: Sr. Product Manager, Amazon Pay
description: 6+ years of product management, product marketing or related experienceBachelor degree requiredExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAn entrepreneurial mentality; willingness to roll up the sleeves and do whatever is necessary to meet goalsExperience developing high-tech products and servicesKeen analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases, attention to detailStrong bias for action; ability to juggle multiple competing priorities and create a sense of urgency in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentProven track record driving innovation on behalf of both enterprises and consumersExcellent customer intuition; demonstrated success in creating innovative and user-friendly digital services and customer-facing featuresAmazon is an equal opportunity employer.Senior Product Manager, Amazon PayThe Amazon Pay team is looking for a Senior Product Manager to define and execute a product roadmap to enable Amazon Pay merchants to grow their business and serve their customers better every day. This role will own the value proposition creation and development for Amazon Pay’s data & analytics products and services to deliver actionable customer and operations insights to Amazon Pay merchants.What is Amazon Pay?Amazon Pay is a high growth, flywheel-based startup business within Amazon. Started in 2015, Amazon Pay is now available in 18 countries, enabling merchants to leverage our trusted, seamless buying experience to allow more than 300 million active Amazon customers to purchase from them—online, in-store, across an array of consumer devices and with Alexa! It also offers the opportunity to meaningfully augment the customer benefits of an Amazon account through its use at a variety of 3rd party merchants.As a Senior Product Manager on the Amazon Pay team, what exactly would I do?Product Managers at Amazon Pay are entrepreneurs at heart, so they are curious about our customers problems and love listening to them, lead cross-functional teams and effectively navigate the unknown with grit and perseverance. title: Senior Product Manager, Tech - Automated Buying Systems
description: Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or related fieldsKnowledge of Supply Chain/Logistics/Operations5+ years work experience managing multiple competing priorities and engaging technical & non-technical stakeholdersAbility to work with teams at all levels of the organizationExperience shaping business strategy for technical products or servicesThe Senior PM-T will own the roadmap for a team of Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Business Intelligence Engineers whose mission it is to surface, quantify and, where possible, capitalize on opportunities for improving Buying outcomes. This includes driving improvements in the quality of system inputs (and making the system resilient to their absence, volatility, or egregiousness), identifying optimal buying strategies for various types of products, and identifying gaps in interactions between Buying and other systems.Within this team, the PM-T will build a new product called "Adaptive Buying", which perturbs Buying decisions based on machine learning models in order to identify gaps, as well as expand an existing product that uses machine learning models to monitor the input and output quality of the system.Business/Team IntroductionThe Buying team is part of Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technology / Inventory Planning and Control organization, and is responsible for deciding how much inventory to carry of every single item offered by Amazon Retail on all of Amazon’s websites worldwide. Consuming inputs including demand forecasts, placement options, and vendor capability data, our buying system automatically computes the optimal inventory levels and re-order quantities for every single item in our Retail catalog every single day. As a PM-T in Buying, you will operate at the apex of multiple advanced Amazon systems, getting global visibility of how Amazon functions and serves our customers. Your curious mind and pragmatic, collaborative work ethic will enable the creation of solutions that drive ever-greater automation, scalability and optimization of every aspect of buying, removing cost and delivering speed of execution to thrill our customers. The impact of your work will be global, material and remarkable.PM-T ResponsibilitiesAs a Sr. PM-T, you will be responsible for building new products, driving the roadmap of the Data Science team, charting and executing strategies for both new and existing business and inventory management optimization products, collaborating with our many internal customers and partners to maximize long-term free cash flow and position inventory management at Amazon for future success.You would be a great fit for the role if you are voraciously curious about Amazon’s supply chain operations, have immense bias for action and an excellent ability to deliver results even in the face of strong headwinds. You would enjoy and excel at driving local operations, sharing knowledge and plans, and managing stakeholders’ expectations. You would have strong organizational, writing, and influencing skills and gather and use data to guide your decision-making. You would have some experience building data science products and you would be looking for an opportunity to work in a team that applies machine learning to real-world, high-impact decisions.Major responsibilities include:Building and managing high quality product roadmapsGaining support for your strategy and roadmap from stakeholders by writing narratives and influencing peers and senior leadershipCreating program goals and related metrics, tracking progress and managing through obstacles to achieve your objectivesCommunicating performance, executing and articulating root-cause analysis and linking to specific improvement areasExecuting launches of new features created by SCOT software teamsPartnering with key stakeholders to define product strategyPromoting data-driven decision-making throughout the teamAddressing barriers through problem solving and coordination with stakeholdersPartnering with other teams across Retail and Supply Chain to identify and influence development of new products and servicesActing as an ambassador for the IPC Buying teamSharing best practices with other Amazon teamsMBA or Master’s degree in Engineering, Management, or Technology preferredBackground in data science / machine learningExperience building data science / machine learning based productsExperience building roadmaps, managing product backlogs, and working closely with software development teams to build new products in a startup environmentStrong process engineering abilitiesExcellent business judgmentStrong critical thinking skills with ability to challenge normal operationsStrong ability to communicate clearly and compellingly, both verbally and in writingExperience retrieving and using data to illustrate business conclusionsProven track record of taking ownership and driving resultsStrong bias for action and ability to work iterativelyDemonstrated ability to innovate with a strong customer and quality focusEntrepreneurial spirit

title: Senior Development Manager
description: Bachelor's degree in technology or technology management related field10+years of experience in software development management in the technology spaceAre you interested in the cutting-edge technologies? Are you interested to know how Amazon offers the best delivery experience to customers? Are you interested to have very large business impact?If yes, this job is right for you.For millions of customers worldwide, the Amazon name is synonymous with delivery – and the Delivery Experience (DEX) team provides those customers with innovative ways to get what they want and need, enabling the choices they make on every order, every day. We combine customer impact with retail invention, solving huge technical challenges along the way.DEX defines, builds, launches and manages customer-facing delivery programs and features across all of Amazon. We own systems that power retail delivery (both customer-facing and back-end), leveraging company-wide technology solutions or designing them from the ground up. Together, DEX is changing how customers experience delivery – from the speed, convenience, and selection features they see on the site every day, to launching Prime delivery benefits and other new programs to customers around the world.Senior Development Manager of DEX AI teamThe Senior Development Manager of DEX AI team owns the development work to apply the machine learning techniques to solve the real business problems. you will be the technical owner for your products and guide the execution to realize the business impact. title: Sr. Technical Program Manager, Amazon Security Compliance Controls Framework
description: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.7+ years of technical program management experience12+ years of experience working in the field of information security and risk managementDemonstrated experience with at-scale project and stakeholder managementUnderstanding of information security, privacy frameworks, and compliance requirementsTechnical knowledge in multiple security domain areas such as engineering, applications, system and network security, authentication or security protocolsSecurity knowledge on current threats, trends and mitigationsSkilled in risk management, business risk analysis and making complex business/risk trade-off recommendations and decisionsDemonstrated ability to work through ambiguity to detailed solutionsMaturity, judgment, and proven ability to lead and influence others.Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, product managers, and senior business leaders.High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.Able to work in a diverse teamAmazon.com is looking for a Security Technical Program Manager (TPM) to focus on Information Security programs at global level. In this senior role with company-wide scope you will work with cross-functional leaders of technical and non-technical key stakeholders to define strategy, communicate, and drive full life-cycle security assurance programs. You will own the Amazon Control Framework which is the foundation for our security assurance and compliance strategy, and helps us to achieve a ‘test once – use many – report many’ model. This is achieved by normalization of various in-scope security compliance requirements into a common controls framework supported by activities that are tested against in-scope systems, services, and processes to capture evidence. The framework will be the foundation using which we will build scalable systems that will enable automated collection of controls evidence, where feasible, and also allow system/service owners and leaders to always have an up-to-date view of the compliance state of thousands of services/systems. for our employees  managers and leaders  you are experienced in taking new ideas and driving them to execution  you are pro-active and take initiative to complete tasks and projects quickly and autonomously  and thrive in a dynamic  fast-paced environment  to excel in this role  you will need to be a creative problem solver  comfortable with ambiguity  a highly-effective communicator  and to execute with minimal direction while also effectively collaborating in a team environmentstrong business acumen  consultation skills and solid understanding of the link between learning solutions title: Solar - Civil Project Manager- Granite Power Inc. - Midwest
description: solar - civil project manager- granite power inc  - midwest job number  20000197 building a career at granite may be the most valuable thing you could do   are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to build your career and personal brand  if so  then you’ve come to the right place since 1922  granite construction has continued its long standing commitment to building some of america’s largest infrastructure projects including highways  bridges  dams  rail  and power  recognized as one of the top 25 largest construction companies in the u s   granite specializes in complex infrastructure projects and provides award-winning construction services in mining  earthwork  water sewer  power  tunneling  rail  highway and bridge construction  granite also produces construction materials-sand  gravel  ready-mix  recycled asphalt product and asphalt concrete  and is a proven leader in alternative procurement project delivery at granite  our employees are our most valued asset and we are passionate about retaining  developing  and recruiting the best talent available  our employees reflect our core values  honesty  integrity  fairness  accountability  consideration of others  pursuit of excellence  reliability safety and citizenship and we are continuously looking for individuals who possess a winning attitude and share our core values  in exchange  we help you build a career that no other company can duplicate  you will be part of a learning culture  where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged  excellence is rewarded  and diversity is respected and valued  add our award winning safety program  ethics  reputation  and a commitment to continuous improvement and you’ll see that we are building more than infrastructure—together  we are building your future general summarythe project manager will be responsible for the overall direction  completion and financial outcome for solar  industrial or heavy industrial epc projects  the ideal candidate will have previous experience with epc gc cmgc oe high voltage t d construction  renewable power generation or civil engineering essential job accountabilities1  perform accurate project revenue and cost financial forecasting to ensure corporate profitability goals are met 2  coordinate with estimators and project controls group to establish budget 3  lead estimating efforts on vertically integrated projects to ensure accurate and consistent bid to build process 4  coordinate efforts with estimators  large project sponsor  and manager of construction to manage resources to meet project schedule 5  participate in bid review and bid closing to ensure accuracy of bid and evaluate project feasibility  work with estimating team to develop bid schedule 6  coordinate with large project sponsor  manager of construction and project team to develop comprehensive plan for project start up and successful kick-off 7  provide environment where dynamic project communication occurs between project engineers  foremen  superintendents and construction manager to ensure work is accomplished in an efficient  profitable  and safe manner 8  ensure proper job controls  i e  quantities  costs  revenue and schedule 9  establish and maintain working relationships with owners  agencies  subcontractors  corporate management  inspectors  etc   providing customer service to develop long-term partnerships with client base 10  ensure accurate construction reports for the job allowing for continuous improvement in performance 11  run projects at profitability levels to meet or exceed expected margins 12  comply  understand  and support corporate safety initiatives to ensure a safe work environment educationbs degree in construction management  business administration  or related field or equivalent work experience in heavy civil or solar construction work experiencethree  3  to five  5 + years progressive project experience in heavy civil environments or solar renewable environmentsknowledge  skills  and abilitiesmaintain ability to work in high production environment demonstrated decision-making skills excellent leadership skills excellent supervisory communication and organizational skills accuracy at all times physical demandsthe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job  while performing the duties of this job  the employee is regularly required to talk and hear  the employee frequently is required to stand  walk  sit and use hands to operate a computer keyboard  the employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms  the employee must occasionally lift and or move up to 50 pounds  specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision  and ability to adjust focus  reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions  subject to outside working conditions  at times will be working around large construction equipment  must be safety conscience additional requirements skillsability to abide by granite’s code of conduct on a daily basis a team player about granite construction incorporatedgranite construction incorporated is a member of the s p 400 index and is the parent company of granite construction company  one of the nation s largest heavy civil contractors and construction materials producers  granite construction is an affirmative action equal opportunity employer of minorities  females  protected veterans  individuals with disabilities and a drug-free workplace  for additional information on applicant employee title: Manager, Construction
description: position purpose the purpose of this position is to assist the project manager  or project engineer with constructability during detail design and reg’s fel process  this position will responsible to plan and execute the construction phase of projects  achieve the corporate safety goals for the project while executing the field portion of the project to budget and schedule  closely working with reg’s vendors and subcontractors to ensure reg’s corporate and project goals are met  our vision zero safety program is a holistic program that requires the construction manager to strengthen working relationships with staff  contractors and vendors essential job functions design and planningcoordinate with other reg departments  plants  and outside third party design teams developing initial project concepts including project scope definition  conceptual estimate  and schedule  based on those concepts assist the project mgr or engineer to complete a business case for project execution assist the project mgr or project engineer with the selection and review of proposal responses  drafting contracts  and negotiating consultant or contract agreements work with the project mgr or engineer to obtain existing facility documents while maintaining company file structure  complete needs assessment of missing documentsvisit project sites to review existing conditions and capabilities coordinate with reg manufacturing and reg synthetic fuels during pfds and pids development to insure through constructability all non-process related elements are considered prior to incorporation in the design package demonstrate an understanding of 3d model concepts  lead project design review sessions demonstrate thorough understanding of governmental and industry accepted requirements and regulations such as building codes  nfpa codes  api  life safety codes  nec  and environmental develop reg construction specifications standards for architectural  civil  and structural for specific projects understand local construction permit requirementsprovide input for value analysis or scope reduction enhancement efforts develop project charters and project roles and responsibilities lists perform constructability reviews with the use of the pdri process estimatinghelp to develop the factors for the internal or external generation of project estimates and capture historical cost information upon project completion solicit project bids and analyze vendor and contractor proposals utilize local information to assist in the development of labor rates  equipment rates etc procurementpurchase orders and contracts  draft  distribute for internal approval  negotiate terms  secure insurance certificate and bonds  and finalize ready for execution  ensure contractors and vendors do not proceed without an executed agreement  proper insurance certificate  and property insurance is in place  demonstrate a thorough understanding of negotiation change orders  identify change order potential and forecast their impacts before they are received from contractors or vendors  review all change requests against contract terms  negotiate  up to authority limits  change order terms with contractor or vendor  draft co’s  distribute for internal approval  finalize ready for execution and obtain final signatures review drawings to understand material equipment lists in order to correctly write scope documents while identifying entity responsibility for purchases  expedite deliveries to meet schedule goals billing and cost reportingdevelop schedule of values for pay applications accountable for review and approval of pay applications  confirm billing amount matches contract terms and work completed at the project site  forward to director for final approval accountable for developing and maintaining an accurate and up-to-date job cost report during construction  report includes all project financial information and a projection of cost to finish accountable for accuracy of the job cost report accountable for the accuracy of project  contractor  and vendor financial files according to department standards construction managementscheduling  demonstrate a thorough understanding of project scheduling software appropriate for the project size and scope  accountable for on-time project completion  accountable for developing the design and construction schedule   schedule can be created by pm  pe or using contractor resources   update the as required to properly manage the projects rfi’s  responsible for the review and response to rfi’s from contractors and vendors  accountable for maintaining an rfi log for the project submittals  expedite  coordinate review with reg internal resources  contractors and vendors  thoroughly review civil  structural and architectural submittals to ensure compliance with project specifications  coordinate submittals from separate contractors and vendors to ensure they are complementary  stamp and sign all submittals  and maintain submittal log safety  comply with all project safety requirements  work to correct unsafe conditions when observed or notified of them  champion visionzero on all assigned projects supervise the development of project punch lists and completion of outstanding items start up  responsible for setting project tone  tempo and understanding by all parties close out  assist in obtaining all required closeout information  warranties  training  maintenance materials  o m  as-built  material certificates  and system integrity information for psi documentation purposes  in a timely fashion to allow for expeditious completion of the closeout process develop and maintain project files and collaboration software for sharing of information accountable for the accuracy of project  contractor  and vendor project files according to department standards lead weekly or as required field scheduling and commercial meetings with contractors and the plant representative  prepare oversee the minutes for those meetings ensure contractors follow qa qc requirements for the project  assemble documentation for closeout document and report all potential scope issues to director travel to project sites to monitor construction progress and coordinate with engineers and contractors makes routine decisions on project and consults more experienced staff on difficult decisions demonstrates a thorough understanding of reg’s biodiesel  renewable diesel and other biochemical technologies frequent travel and overnight travel required perform other duties as assignedjob requirements be available for daily work as requiredcommunicate effectively both verbally and in writing with customers and co-workersability to work both calculator  etc  willingness to take initiative and openness to continuous learning opportunitiessolve analytical problems and critical thinking skillsmust have maintain current driver’s license and  master’s degree in a technical area or business is a plus experience required  4-8 yrs  in construction management at risk or direct hire construction  must understand and have executed lump sum title: Technical Program Manager - AI, SW and Physics
description: job opening id  123194ann arbor  mi  united statesfull-timeregularcompany overviewcalling the adventurers ready to join a company that s pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling  at kla  we re making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen who are we  we research  develop  and manufacture the world s most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries  we enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology  creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light  we create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket  the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better  we re passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn t be possible without us  the future is calling  will you answer group divisionkla has always had a close relationship with physics and data  our optical and electron beam inspection and measurement tools use cutting edge physics models  both for hardware design and as part of their algorithms  ai  including several traditional machine learning techniques and deep learning are routinely used to process this data to meet application requirements the ai   modeling center of excellence  centered in kla’s r d facility in ann arbor  mi  was setup with the mission of advancing kla’s traditional strengths in physics and data and providing implementation solutions for multiple kla inspection and metrology products targeted at the semiconductor manufacturing industry as a part of this group  you will be part of a world class team of physicists  hpc system designers  machine learning and application engineers who build cutting edge solutions for modeling complex imaging techniques and semiconductor processes  you will also work with a data scientists and ai infrastructure engineers whose mission is to build and scale machine learning based solutions for our semiconductor customers we are looking for engineers in a few different fields  if you are passionate about physics modeling  high performance computing - hpc  including gpu   ml  data  or cloud technologies – this is the place for you responsibilitiesthe ai and modeling center of excellence in ann arbor is a functional organization  the three focus areas for the group are physics modeling  ai and ai related software platforms  teams within each group support multiple product lines  any engineer in the organization has multiple stakeholders in both the functional organization local to ann arbor  as well as the product groups which are often in california  the technical program manager is expected to have two main job responsibiliites 1  maintain communications and alignement with all stakeholders for selected product focused programs 2  support engineers and tech leads in ann arbor with execution on a more concrete level  the following job responsibilites are expected organize and maintain alignment on deliverables with each program  program stakeholders are often in kla s california hq  prepare and maintain cadence of internal ann arbor functional leadership team meetings  divisional product program execution reviews and technology reviews have sufficient technical depth  at least in software  and if possible in ai  to understand technical challenges and potential roadblocks for the team and facilitate proactively addressing them  example ordering long lead time items  insisting on formal knowledge transfer for techincally challenging work items etc  help tech leads with project management support as requested  there are several programs in ann arbor and most are self sufficient  but some programs may request help from a tpm during critical execution phases track execution of projects closely  and dig into problem areas to proactively escalate to a2 leadership for visibility and handling  the  technical  part of the technical manager role is expected to be very important for success in this role  the tpm should be able to dig into details in sw and ai areas as needed to understand and lead discussion on potential solutions manage non program work items calendar drive necessary activities  internships  university relations activities  non product related activities like infrastructure development  be point of escalation for all programs if and when they have hitches in execution qualificationsmasters degree in engineering  cs or related area more than 7 years experience in software development related roles at least 4 years experience with project management and program management excellent communication skills and proben track record managing stakeholders outside immeditate reporting structure of the organization exceptional ability and proven track record of communicating program status and iniatives to executive management minimum qualificationsbachelors degree in engineering  cs or related area more than 5 years experience in software development related roles at least 3 years experience with project management and program management excellent communication skills and proben track record managing stakeholders outside immeditate reporting structure of the organization exceptional ability and proven track record of communicating program status and iniatives to executive management equal employment opportunitykla is an equal opportunity employer  applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age  race  color  religion  sex  sexual orientation  gender identity  national origin  protected veteran status  disability  or any other characteristics protected by applicable law

sales taxprepare sales tax returns and responses to tax noticesmaintain tax records  related schedules  and reports in preparation of auditrequired qualifications bachelor’s degree related to gaming room including an arcade  2 000+ games frequent team and company outingslimitless opportunities for professional growth

title: Senior Product Manager, Trust & Safety
description: overviewevery year  people across the world spend nearly one trillion dollars on groceries  groceries are a vital part of our lives  but shopping for them hasn t fundamentally changed since the first supermarket opened 100 years ago food is sustenance  but it s also much more than that  food can be a part of a daily ritual or a special moment that resonates with people on a meaningful and emotional level  it can be a much-needed break in a long day  a taste that brings back memories  a creative experiment  a shared meal with loved ones  or even comfort during a hard time  whether it s a special occasion or an everyday occurrence  it should always be easy for people to get the ingredients they need the instacart product team is dedicated to making grocery shopping effortless for everyone  by helping take care of the shopping  we help people get great food and give them back time so they can do what matters most to them  we re finding solutions to large-scale challenges that will forever change the way people feed themselves and their loved ones we re building a team of incredibly talented product leaders to define and execute on our vision of being the world leader in online grocery  you ll work among star engineers  designers  data scientists  and operators in a fast-growing environment  the role demands a mix of principled thinking  well-honed product sense  and technical depth about the trust   safety teamwe re looking for a product manager to join our trust   safety product team  whose mission is to maintain the integrity of the instacart platform for shoppers  customers and retailers  the trust and safety pm will focus on 2 primary areas identity verificationbackend classificationyou will be responsible for building a cohesive vision and product strategy for verifying the identity of instacart s community of shoppers  you will lead efforts to build confidence in our shopper base and have a better understanding of our relationship with them additionally you will build out instacart s growing efforts in machine learning detection to more proactively detect and prevent negative behavior on the instacart platform  you will partner with instacart s trust   safety operations team to identify the biggest opportunities to make instacart safe and secure  you will develop and deploy new ml models targeting abuse as well as build front-end product solutions for anyone suspected of abusive behavior about the joblead a cross-functional team of engineering  design  research  data science  operations  marketing  local markets  and more you ll drive product definition  strategy  and long term vision for initiatives across audiences of our 4-sided marketplace  connecting customers  shoppers  retailers  and advertiserswork closely with teams spread across instacart s different locations  san francisco  toronto  atlanta  with a willingness to travel to those locations as neededidentify the biggest problems to solve  drive new feature development from start to finishrun user research  usability studies  data-driven experiments to inform product directionbuild  measure  and iterate rapidlyconsistently integrate behavior data and customer feedback into key product decisionscommunicate product plans  benefits and results to all audiences - within teams  company  to users  press etc about youa minimum of 5-6 years in product management at a technology company  with 2-3 years in trust   safety or riskexperience building cross-platform experiences  mobile  desktop  mobile web experience delivering impactful products and features that are heavily informed by data as well as user researchexperience partnering with engineering on developing  evaluating and deploying machine-learning models for detecting suspicious negative activity demonstrated ability to solve complex problems by creating customer-first solutions and thinking from first principlespassion for building products that unlock value for people who are not power usersexperience influencing the executive team members on key strategy and cross-functional initiatives
